This will be his first loan term with KADET LTD and he plans to use the loan amount to buy welding machines, nuts and spanners as well as car spare parts. This will enable him serve his customers well, by meeting their demands.

He hopes to grow his business and open a shop for selling vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy welding machines, nuts and spanners as well as car spare parts.

loans.name: Gustavo Neftali

texts.es: Gustavo, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus 2 hijo. Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace varios años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Gustavo lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. For several years, he has worked growing corn and beans in order to earn a living and put bread on the table. He cultivates his crops year after year, and it is the only means he knows of making a living. He is a very hardworking, respectable and responsible man. Despite his humble living conditions, he works tirelessly to give the best to his family. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy basic agricultural supplies: fertilisers, pesticides, seeds etc. He trusts in God that he will have an abundant harvest which will allow him to continue bringing home his family's daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and seeds

loans.name: Tumendemberel

texts.en:
Borrower Mrs.Tumendemberel is a married woman who lives with her family in the outer ger district of the city. She works as a seller at a local indoor market while her husband runs a taxi business. "Tumee" has one son who attends primary school. 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase housing materials which will be used to continue the building of her half-finished house. The family lives in that half-finished house. She is a very hardworking person who is willing to create better living conditions and a comfortable life for her family.

loans.use: to continue the building of her half-finished house.

loans.name: Konah

texts.en:
Konah is 31 years old and lives in West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married with five children, ages 3, 7, 9, 12 and 16. All of her kids are going to school and live at home. She is a high school graduate and she is a potential businesswoman. Her husband sells charcoal and Konah is selling charcoal too, managing her own business well to enable her to help her husband with some expenses in the home. 

Over the past five years she has been running this shop which is close to the local market without facing any serious problem. This business started with a little amount she got from her husband. She sells six days every week, spending 8 hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business.

Konah plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny, de 41 años de edad , esta casada con Gabriel y tiene 03 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Jenny  se dedica a la venta de comidas criollas como  guiso de pollo, asado de pollo,  adobo de res, entre otros. Su negocio lo realiza en el frontis de su hogar y lleva 12 años dedicándose a esta labor. Comenta que se inicio en esta actividad por la idea  de una amiga quien le propuso que trabajaran juntas elaborando los deliciosos platos de comida, actualmente siguen trabajando juntas .  Considera rentable su negocio porque donde vive hay varios trabajadores a quienes les brinda este servicio de comida ya que no tienen tiempo para cocinar en sus casas. El problema que tenía  al iniciar su negocio era la falta de capital para poder comprar sus mesas, sillas y productos para la preparación de las distintas comidas pero poco a poco fueron juntando dinero y comprando todo lo que necesitaba. Espera poder seguir creciendo y construir un local cómodo para la atención a las personas que acuden a comprar sus deliciosas viandas.Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado.Con el monto solicitado de 500 soles comprará arroz, huevos, carnes y otros productos que utiliza para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
41-year-old Jenny is married to Gabriel and has three children with whom she lives in her own home.  Jenny's business is selling creole dishes such as chicken stew, barbecued chicken, 'adobo de res' (beef stew with rice and beans) etc.  Her business is located just outside her home and she has been running it for 12 years.  She says that she started out in this business when her friend had an idea and suggested that they work together making delicious meals.  They are still working together now.  Jenny considers her business to be profitable because where she lives there are a number of workers who she provides her meal service to as they don't have enough time to cook at home.  The problem that she faced when she started her business was a lack of capital with which to buy tables, chairs and supplies for preparing her different meals.  However, she and her friend gradually got together enough money to buy everything they needed.

Jenny hopes to continue growing her business and would like to build comfortable business premises where she can serve the people who come to buy her delicious dishes.  This is her second Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support.  Jenny will use the 500 soles she has requested to buy rice, eggs, meat and other products that she will use to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, eggs, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a 58-year-old widow who lives in Vanadzor, which is in the region of Lori. She lives with her son who is a serviceman. Anahit graduated from the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute Physics Department, and since 1975 she has been working at the local school as a teacher of physics. 

Her teacher salary is too low and she has found another way to both earn more money and be useful with her knowledge of physics. Anahit teaches a personal course in physics and she also helps pupils to take courses for attending the Institute. She does her work with great pleasure and love. She says that she loves children very much and she can work with them for hours. 

Anahit wants to buy a new computer which will help her to always have materials ready for her courses. For this she is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams. She thinks that education is the basis of everything and she is sure that Kiva lenders will appreciate and support her.

loans.use: To buy a new computer.

loans.name: Daudi

texts.en:
Daudi is 39 years old and married; he has two children. He has a retail shop in Kitengela town where he sells retail goods such as flour, sugar, cooking fat and other items.

He plans to use this loan to buy stocks of goods to sell in his retail shop. These include detergents, cooking oil, maize flour, milk and bread. This will enable him to have enough inventory to meet the demands of his customers.

He hopes to grow his business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of goods to sell.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah resides in Nkubu, which is in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She has been a farmer for one year. She grows cabbages and bananas and sells them in the local market.

She has asked Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase poultry.She wants to produce more crop products and engage in mixed farming in the next five years. The challenges she faces are:drought, pests and diseases.

This loan will help her engage more in farming and to uplift her living standards. She is happy with Juhudi Kilimo because it offers a grace period to its clients.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Annita

texts.en: Annita is 39 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She lives with her husband, who is a desk worker. They have two children aged 9 and 7, both of whom are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past 2 years, she has been running a shop where she sells chloride, soap, toothpaste, and other similar items in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by husband. She walks every day to buy her goods since her shop is much closer the local wholesales center. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for her business. She plans to build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina, 51 years of age, is married and has five children.She sells bags in Tala town. Having been in this business for the last 10 years, it has been profitable and she has been able to provide for the needs of her family. Besides this, she is also a dairy farmer and sells milk to various retailers in the area.

This being her third loan, she plans to buy more variety of bags to sell.She also wants to buy animal feed for her dairy cows. She anticipates making more income which she will use to pay school fees for her children.

Angelina hopes to expand her business by supplying bags and thereby make more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags and also buy  animal feed

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 28-year-old Kadiatu from Moriba town Bo. She is single with 1 child, age 2 years. She began this business because she was a dropout from school and she wants to generate income to further her schooling and to take care of her child.

Kadiatu runs a used clothing business, selling male and female shirts. She has been running this business for 4 years. She works at the business 8 hours per day and 6 days per week. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to this business is the high cost of transportation.

She has requested a loan in order to purchase more used clothing to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has 3 children, ages 31, 27 and 21. 

In 2002, Kadiatu established her motor vehicle spare parts business. She began her business because there was no one to take care of her schooling. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy more spare parts for her business, like oil filters, clutch plates and engine oil. She was unable to open a sales outlet because she was disappointed by the person who promised to rent her the space. She used the proceeds of her last loan to pay school fees for her children and to provide livelihood for her family.  

In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a bigger shop to be managed by her husband and to continue to support her children's education.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Hamamt Al-Salam Group

texts.en: This group, called Hamamt Al-Salam, consists of four members who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER. Hana is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been selling food for one year. She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. She requests a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy food to stock up her business so as to be able to meet her customers' demands and to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy food to stock up her business.

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 31-year-old married man, father of one child. He has been working as a butcher for 14 years. In 2011, Wael opened his own business to develop his living and increase his income.

Wael is a hard worker, well known in his region with his good reputation and quality of meat served. He sells meat in wholesale and retail upon request.

Wael is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance to his shop to keep it a healthy medium and attractive enough for present customers and new ones.

Wael hopes that through applying for future loans, he will expand his butchery, and increase his wholesale capital, and open a small restaurant of his own.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his shop

loans.name: Suhana

texts.en:
Ms. Suhana is a 52-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and two children. For about seven years she has been running a business of selling lace which is used in clothing. She makes beautiful lace in almost every color and design according to the choice of her customers. People of her community prefer to buy fancy and simple lace from her for their clothes. 

Suhana is the best earning resource in her household. To grow her sales, she needs to purchase additional material such as ribbons and thread in various colors with packs of sequins and pearls for embellishment. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. In this way she would be able to expand her sales which ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase additional material such as ribbons and thread in various colors with packs of sequins and pearls for embellishment.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 44-year-old, active married woman and a mother of five children. She faced many problems during her early married life as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. This compelled Razia to initiate her business of cosmetic sales to contribute to the family income. She offers various products of good quality and counts a good client list. 

To meet the demand of her customers, she needs to purchase more items such as cleansers, facials, lipssticks and packs of makeup kits. For this reason she applied for her second loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kashf Foundation.  She expects a boost in her earnings and desires to spend part of the income on providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as cleansers, facials, lipssticks and packs of make-up kits.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en: Ms. Basheeran is a 45-year-old lady and a mother of 5 children. She has been running a business of animal purchase and resale for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf foundation. Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have four children ages 7, 9, 12, and 15, who are in school and live at home. Musu described herself as a hardworking person. She has been running a shop where she sells charcoal for the past three years in the local market. She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by husband. By the means of pickup she gets her goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 35 and lives in Ijevan with his wife and small son. Since 1996 he has been engaged in the trading business which brings good income for his family. They managed to do some repairing around their house and they have also managed to buy furniture for their guestroom. Robert has a small rented stall at Ijevan central market, which is well known since he has clothes of big sizes and kids’ clothes as well. Robert has taken a loan from Nor Horizon for the ninth time and it is his third one from Kiva. All of them he has paid back successfully. This time he decided to cooperate with Kiva lenders again and he asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to buy a new summer clothes collection to enlarge the assortment in his stall. He hopes that his third deal with Kiva will have the same success as the last ones.

loans.use: to buy a new summer clothes collection to enlarge the assortment in his stall.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, 46, is a married woman who has manufactured carpets for many years. She offers handmade carpets in various colors and designs and has become famous for providing good quality products in her circle. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She is mother of two children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing and education. She also sews as a part time job. In this way she is able to handle her family's needs and requirements effectively.  It’s her sixth year with the Kashf Foundation and she is satisfied with its support. Currently, she is applying for a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales and thereby better support her family.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella operates a wholesale shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites the high cost of transportation as her major challenge. 

She is requesting Kshs 30,000 to boost her shop by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding her wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married and she owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She operates a fish selling business, selling at the market to her clients. In addition she also operates a food vending business which earns her another source of income. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase fish and cooking oil for the preparation of dried fish. She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase fish and cooking oil for the preparation of dried fish.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms Yasmeen is a 40 year old married woman. She is been doing hand embroidery for about two years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed in factory, but he does not earn enough to support his family alone. Yasmeen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of five children; four of them are in school. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demands of her customers. She is in her 6th loan cycle. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Ms. Asmat is a 28-year-old vigorous, married woman. She has been doing a business of shoe making for many years. With the passage of time she has attained a regular list of customers and earns enough to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of six children; two of them are school-going. She is motivated to provide them with good food, health and education. This is her fifth year with Kashf Foundation. With its support, she is fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her children’s education. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy additional material for shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence can better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional material for shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles etc.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Ms. Maryam is a 42-year-old married woman. She is been working making 'waan' which is a material used in making charpoy (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan.Two years ago, she started her business to contribute in the family income to meet the expenses of her family members.  She offers various kinds of 'waan' in different colors, and has become famous for providing good quality material in her community.  

Maryam requires improving her business so she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy a new machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread to increase her sales. She dreams of providing quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to buy a new machine to make ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread.

loans.name: Azizan

texts.en:
Ms. Azizan is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of two children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been running a canteen (cafe) for the last five years in a school. She is famous for providing quality goods and is contentedly doing it for the sake of her children, to provide them quality education and a better lifestyle. Her children are going to private school and she wants their bright and prosperous future. Her husband also helps her in purchasing goods from the market. 

Currently she applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets, toffees and beverages to meet the demand of her customers time after time.  She has been in association with Kashf for seven years and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets, toffees and beverages.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en: Ms. Shakeela is a 53-year-old, married, vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibbers to increase her sales. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibbers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery, de 28 años de edad , está casada y tiene tres hijos de 8, 4 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, ella junto a su esposo y sus hijos viven en una casa propia en donde comparten todos los días la alegría de progresar y mejorar juntos.Rosmery tiene como fuente de ingresos económicos la venta de frutas y verduras regionales tales como limones, aguajes , maíz, arroz, frijoles , entre otros. Realiza sus ventas en el frontis de su vivienda en donde instala una mesa con todo lo que tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo hace 2 años y le esta yendo muy bien.Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando su labor aprendió muchas cosas ya que las experiencias que ha tenido en este corto tiempo le enseñaron a ser mas cuidadosa con algunos productos y a poder invertir más en otros.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el  monto solicitado comprará plátanos, frutas, maíz y frijoles en sacos .
texts.en:
Rosmery is twenty-eight years old, is married, and has three children, ages 8, 4, and 2 respectively.  She lives with her husband and children in their own house, where they share the happiness of moving ahead and improving together every day.  As a source of economic income, Rosmery sells regional fruits and vegetables, like limes, aguaje fruit, corn, rice, beans, and others.  She makes her sales outside her home where she has a table to display everything she has to offer her customers.  She has been doing this for two years and it is going very well.  During this time working, she has learned many things; the experiences that she has had in this short time have taught her to be very careful with some products and to invest more in others.

In this opportunity, she is requesting 2000 soles.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, and she will therefore feel safe in advancing her business.  She also promises to comply with paying her installments in a punctual manner.  

With the loan, she will buy plantains, fruit, corn, and beans in sacks.

loans.use: to buy regional fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis tiene 55 años de edad es casado tiene seis hijos, vive con los hijos y la conyugue en la ciudad de Guaranda.
Es integrante de la Ventanilla  Los pinos, se encuentra formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura queda a 40 minutos de la oficina Comunidad Pangua.

Luis  se dedica  a la siembra de papas, maíz, trigo, además se dedica a la crianza de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar y aumentar los animales.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son los problemas de enfermedades en los animales. El sueño es construir una casa.
En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las festividades.
texts.en:
Luis is 55 years old.  He is married and he has six children.  He lives with his children and his spouse in the city of Guaranda.  He is a member of the Los Pinos communal bank which is made up of 14 members that are from the same agricultural community located 40 minutes from the Pangua Community office. 

Luis plants potatoes, corn and wheat and he also raises livestock.  He is requesting the loan to buy a cow.  With the help from the loan he will be able to buy and raise the animals.  The challenges that he faces are problems with illnesses in the animals.  

His dream is to build a house.  In this free time he likes to rest and enjoy festivals.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a  41-year-old man from Homabay town. He is married with four children who are 14, nine, seven, and four years old.

He has been a carpenter within his local market for the last 10 years and makes a monthly income of KES. 26,000. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase timber and other materials for his work. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has a dream opening another business and supporting his family by providing them with the best education in their lives.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for his work

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman; she has five children, four of whom attend school. Mary owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business area.
 
With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en: Farhat is a married woman and a mother of three. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. That is why she began doing stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. With this loan, she will be able to purchase more spools of thread, packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. Farhat dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of lace, zippers and buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms. Zahida is a 24-year-old lady. For about five years she is in the business of making hand embroidery. She makes beautiful embroidery patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater for more customers consistently. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers and wishes to spend part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Ghulam-Kubra

texts.en:
Ms. Ghulam-Kubra is a 22-year-old married woman. For the past three years, she has been successfully running a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts on a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Currently, she requests a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) through the Kashf Foundation to purchase another cow to milk. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation since three years ago and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to milk.

loans.name: Kanizan

texts.en:
Ms. Kanizan is a 37-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of milk sales for the past many years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Kanizan’s husband, who assists her by selling milk door-to-door at various places on a daily basis. 

She has one cow for milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. In order to inflate her sales, she needs to purchase another cow. For this, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees). She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Fuentes De Vida Group

texts.es:
Matilde Agüero es la tesorera de Banco Mujer Fuentes de Vida, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 26 años, 2 niños pequeños, es madre soltera y jefa de hogar. Está comerciante tiene mucha experiencia en la venta de ropa y zapatos, y es su negocio el que le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.  Ella y su grupo han recibido 3 créditos anteriormente, y para Matilde son los financiamientos los que le dieron la oportunidad de iniciar su negocio, consolidarlo y así generar los ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. El préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería como; ropa para damas, niños, zapatos, así como reforzar la línea de ropa para hombres ya que se acerca el Día del Padre, además de cumplir con pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. 
El grupo de Matilde está compuesto por 3 socias mas que van a invertir en actividades comerciales agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Matilde Agüero is the treasurer of Banco Mujer Fuentes de Vida (Sources of Life Women's Bank).  She is a very hard-working woman who is 26 years old and has two small children.  She is a single mother and the head of household.  This business woman has a lot of experience selling clothing and shoes and it is her business that allows her to provide for her children.  She and her group have received three previous loans, and for Matilde, it is this financing that has given her the opportunity to start her business, consolidate it, and thus, generate the income necessary to improve her living conditions.  She is going to invest this loan in purchasing merchandise such as clothing and shoes for women and children, as well as replenish her line of men's clothing since Father's Day is approaching.  In addition, she will fulfill the orders that her customers make. 

Matilde's group is made up of three other members who are going to invest in their farming businesses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Roxana Beatríz

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 20 años de edad, es madre de una niña de 10 meses. Se dedica  a la venta de ropa desde hace un año; antes de acompañarse ella estudiaba, pero salio embarazada, por lo que se vio obligada a dejar la escuela. Su suegra la motivo para que instalara un pequeño bazar para obtener los ingresos para los gastos del hogar. Actualmente posee además una pequeña tienda de la canasta básica, se siente muy satisfecha porque posee su negocio propio y no descuida a su hija. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. a realizar los oficios de la casa y posteriormente se dedica a atender su negocio. La mercadería la compra en dos ciudades muy importantes el recorrido es de una hora y media en autobús; pero para abordar el autobús debe caminar a pie unos 10 minutos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos docenas de pantalones para mujer, dos docenas de blusas, cuatro docenas de tangas, cuatro docenas de blúmers, dos docenas de pantalones de hombre, tres docenas de camisetas, una docena de camisas de vestir para hombre y ropa interior de hombre. Así, podrá aumentar la variedad de mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes y la cantidad disponible. Espera aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, para ahorrar y pagar el crédito. Además, su sueño es graduarse de maestra en la universidad, actualmente esta estudiando los días sábados y también desea comprar un terreno para construir su casa ya que esta viviendo con su suegra.
texts.en:
Roxana is 20 years old and has a 10-month-old baby girl.  She has been selling clothing for one year.  Before she met her husband, Roxana was studying but she got pregnant and had to leave school.  Her mother-in-law encouraged her to set up a small general store so that she could make income to contribute towards the household expenses.  She currently also has a small grocery store.  Roxana feels very satisfied as she has her own business and doesn't have to neglect her daughter.  She gets up at 4.30am to do her housework and then works in her business.  She buys her merchandise in two large cities.  The journey she makes, by bus, is one and a half hours long.  Before she can catch the bus, she has a ten minute walk.  

The loan that Roxana is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy two dozen pairs of women's trousers, two dozen blouses, eight dozen pairs of women's underpants in different styles, two dozen pairs of men's trousers, three dozen t-shirts, one dozen men's dress shirts and men's underwear.  This will allow her to increase the range of merchandise she offers her customers and the amount she has available.  She hopes to increase her sales and income so that she can save up and pay back her loan.  Roxana's dream is to graduate from university as a teacher (she is currently studying on Saturdays).  She would also like to buy a plot of land on which to build a house as she is currently living with her mother-in-law.

loans.use: to buy two dozen pairs of women's trousers, two dozen blouses, eight dozen pairs of ladies' underpants in different styles, two dozen pairs of men's trousers, three dozen t-shirts, a dozen men's dress shirts and men's underwear

loans.name: Oscar Alexander

texts.es: Oscar  se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y su  hijo de 6 años. Oscar está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc asi como uestra la fotografia,  ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Oscar has worked in agriculture for a number of years.  He grows beans and corn and, by selling them, is able to cover his household expenses.  He is a responsible, honest and hardworking man who lives with his wife and his six-year-old son.  Oscar is applying for a loan to buy supplies (fertiliser, manure, seeds and weedkiller) for his crops, as shown in the photo, because he cannot afford them on what he earns.  This will enable him to boost his income and be more financially secure.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, manure, seeds, weedkiller etc.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is married and has one child. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 46-year-old mother from Vihiga county. She is married to Benson, who is a farmer and supports the family. She supports four people in her family, and was blessed with three children who are 20, 16 and 12 years old respectively.

She has a green grocery stall which has been operating for the last five years and generates a monthly income of 5,800 KES (Kenyan shillings). She has applied for a third loan with KADET LTD., which she will use to purchase green grocery items. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock.

Her dream is to run a wholesale business and build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase green grocery items.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 58 years old. She lives in the small village of Zestaponi District with husband. Marine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard, with 400 samples of wine trees. They produce wine and sell it at local markets at a good price. Besides that, they have a plot of land where nut trees are grown. They sell nuts locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Marine requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Marine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this credit, Marine will open a grocery shop. As she has a space already near her house, she will purchase a stock of groceries. After opening a shop, she will work hard to increase the income of her family. Part of the income will be reinvested in the business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries for a new grocery shop.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 59 years old. He lives in Zestaponi District with his wife, Maro, and his retired mother. Amiran requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Amiran has a vineyard and a small plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Harvested products are sold at the local markets. The family's additional income is from Amiran’s and Maro’s monthly salaries. Amiran is a fencing teacher, and he gives private lessons. His wife, Maro, is an accountant.
  
Amiran requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Amiran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Amiran will purchase chicks. He wants to start a new poultry business and increase the family's monthly income. When the chicks are grown, Amiran will sell them at a higher price and earn a good profit. Part of the profit will be used for reinvesting in the same business and another part for improving the family's livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase chicks for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, fungicides, pesticides and corn seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese, curd, meat, rice, beans, sugar, salt, soap, and some belts for her mill.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
For the past few years, Faith has owned a retail shop business, where neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishing of goods, leading to losses.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
For over three years, Emily has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 68 years old and married with eight children. His spouse is a housewife and does small-scale farming in order to support him in meeting some of the family's financial needs.

He has been operating a butcher shop for the last 14 years; from this business he gets a monthly profit of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). John has borrowed a loan of 60,000 KES for his second loan from KADET LTD. With this loan, he intends to use the whole amount to purchase animals for slaughter. 

For the anticipated profit, he intends to use it to build his family a new house. His dream is to expand his business to other towns and to be able meet his family's financial needs.

loans.use: To purchase animals for slaughter.

loans.name: Mzomba

texts.en:
Mzomba operates a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit-vending business in the area to raise her profits and support her family fully.

For that reason, with the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaw. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaw.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah operates a retail shop in Olkalau, where she sells a variety of household items like buckets, jugs, thermoses, mugs, etc. She has been in this business for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 shillings.

She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more stock for sale. She repaid her previous loan on time. With the anticipated profit, she hopes to buy more stock and expand her business.  

She hopes to start a wholesale shop and have a stable life in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of household goods like mugs, jugs and buckets.

loans.name: Mayra Carolina

texts.es:
La cliente Mayra, vive en Guayaquil. comenzó la venta de ropa y perfumes ya que paso por una gran necesidad económica. Poco a poco invertía dinero y ganaba hasta que decidió vender en diferentes horarios la ropa. 

En la actualidad sigue con su negocio como comerciante de ropa y perfumes. Ella tiene muchas aspiraciones ya que tiene dos hijos uno de 15 años y otro de 13 años que estudian en una escuela fiscal. 

A pesar de sus ingresos en su negocio ella necesita invertir en los útiles escolares de sus hijos ya que han ingresado a clases y necesitan para el año lectivo.
texts.en:
Mayra lives in Guayaquil.  She started selling clothes and perfume out of great financial necessity.  She invested money little by little.  She earned until she decided to sell clothes on different schedules.

She now continues with her business of selling clothes and perfume.  She has many aspirations because she has two children, ages 15 and 13, who attend public school.

In spite of her income from her business, she needs to invest in her children’s school supplies.  They have started classes, and they need supplies for the school year.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos, vive con su esposa  y su hijo en casa propia, Carlos es un hombre  trabajador y responsable desde a hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas para el ganado que le permita crecer en el negocio. Con esto espera obtener resultados favorables y continuar brindando la ayuda económica a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en: Carlos lives with his wife and his son in their home.  Carlos is a hard-working and responsible man.  For many years, he has worked in the production and sale of dairy products in the area where he lives.  He has a very good clientele since he has discovered how to gain the confidence of his customers.  He offers quality products and good prices, and has decided to invest more in the care of his livestock since his business depends on it.  For this reason, he has requested a loan to be able to purchase vitamins for his cattle which will allow him to grow his business.  With this, he hopes to obtain favorable results and continue providing the financial support to his household that they need so much.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins for his cattle.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
Clara, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos basicos; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para realizar el cultivo tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, semilla de maíz, entre otros; este le ayudara a mejorar la producción, ya que tendrá todo listo para la siembra.
Las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Clara needs a new loan to continue investing in her business growing basic grains.  She will use it to buy agricultural supplies (manure, weed killer, plaguicide, insecticide, pesticide, corn seeds, among other things) which she needs for her crops and to help her boost her production, as she will have everything ready for sowing.  Her financial situation and family circumstances have improved immeasurably.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed killer, plaguicide, insecticide, pesticide, corn seeds, among other things.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable,  Samuel es un hombre dedicado a su labor, luchador siempre dispuesto a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, herramienta, etc. Samuel  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en: Samuel, age 31, lives in his own home with his family.  He works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of corn and beans.  He has worked many years in this area and the experience has been very valuable and allowed him to obtain better harvests.  The land that he cultivates is located in an agricultural zone, and he does business in the surrounding villages.  He already has many reliable customers who always prefer his products because of their quality and really accessible prices, as well as the unparalleled service.  Samuel is a man who is dedicated to his work, a fighter who is always willing to work hard to be successful.  He wants to take advantage of this growth in his business to increase production and thus, have better earnings.  He needs to invest in supples, but he needs capital and that is why he has requested this loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow him to purchase seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizers, tools, etc.  Samuel has good payment references and is sure that he will be able to make his payments on time, and he also has the confidence that he will be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, insecticide, fertilizer, tools, etc.

loans.name: Affivi

texts.fr: Affivi vit avec son conjoint pasteur à Lomé. Âgée de 39ans, elle a appris comme profession la couture et sert ses clients dans un atelier loué à cet effet. En plus de son activité, elle revend des pagnes qu’elle achète au Grand Marché de Lomé. Pour mieux satisfaire ses clients et avoir plus de profit, elle sollicite un premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pagnes. Elle espère réinvestir dans l’activité et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Affivi, age 39, lives in Lomé with her spouse, a preacher. She learned sewing as a profession and provides services to her customers in a workshop that she rents.

In addition, she resells pagnes (colorful African cloth) that she buys at the Grand Market in Lomé. In order to better satisfy her clients and increase her profits, she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy pagnes.

She hopes to reinvest in her business and see her family blossom.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Espoir1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Espoir 1 fait partie de la coopérative Coopajo et est située à Dagadji, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de quatre personnes. 
Assouma a 50 ans. Il s’occupe de quinze personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 28 ans qu'il cultive le cacao et il a 5 hectares de cacao certifiés Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais et des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l'argent supplémentaire, Assouma souhaite pouvoir scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Espoir 1 group is part of the Coopajo cooperative. The group is from Dagadji, a small village in the southwest of Côte d’Ivoire, located in the San Pedro region. This group has four members.

Assouma is 50 years of age. He is responsible for fifteen people at home. He has been growing cacao for the past 28 years, and his five hectares of cacao farmland are certified by the Rainforest Alliance. This means that he adheres to the principles and regulations of sustainable agriculture.

With this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cacao plantation. These items will allow him to increase production and to bolster his income. 

Assouma plans to use the additional revenue to support his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Progrès Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Progrès fait partie de la coopérative Coopasm et est située à Doba, un petit village au sud-ouest de la Côte d’Ivoire dans la région de San Pedro. Le groupe est composé de douze personnes. 
Jacques a 50 ans. Il s’occupe de douze personnes dans son foyer. Cela fait 9 ans qu’il fait partie de la coopérative Coopasm et il a 2,5 hectares de cacao certifiés Rain Forest Alliance, ce qui veut dire qu’il respecte les principes et les normes de l’agriculture durable. 

Grace au crédit, il va pouvoir acheter de l’engrais et des produits phytosanitaires pour sa plantation. Ces produits vont lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et ainsi d’accroître ses revenus. 

Avec l’argent supplémentaire, il va construire une maison pour prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Progrès group is part of the Coopasm cooperative. The group is from Doba, a small village in the southwest of Côte d’Ivoire, located in the San Pedro region. This group has 12 members.

Jacques is 50 years of age. He is responsible for twelve people at home. He joined the Coopasm cooperative nine years ago, and his 2.5 hectares of cacao farmland are certified by the Rainforest Alliance. This means that he adheres to the principles and regulations of sustainable agriculture.

With this loan, he will be able to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his cacao plantation. These items will allow him to increase production and to bolster his income. 

With this additional revenue, he plans to build a house to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en: The borrower, Batchuluun, is married and lives with her husband and two children. She supports her family by operating an accessories stall at one of the local indoor markets. She sells bracelets, barrettes, earrings, and necklaces by "Viennois." Now it’s the graduation season, so she wants to increase her working capital in order to buy a variety of accessories, so she is applying for a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy more accessories to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to buy maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en: Tehmine studies at the Yerevan State Musical College named for R. Meliqyan. She is 21 years old and lives with her parents and her sister. Tehmine's father works as a driver. He is the only breadwinner in the family, and the profit he earns is barely enough to make ends meet. Tehmine has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition. This loan is very important for her, to complete her education, find a good job and be financially stable in life.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne has a retail shop in the Eastlands area of Nairobi. She has been running this business for the past three years, and it has been profitable. She is 32 years of age and single.

This will be her third loan term, and she plans to stock more goods to sell. These include maize flour, sugar, salt, cooking oil, cooking fat, detergents, and rice. She anticipates making more income which she will use to buy more goods.

She hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana tiene 57 años de edad, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella tiene 20 años de dedicarse a destazar cerdos y res, actividad que aprendió de sus padres. Antes tenía una tienda en su casa; pero hoy solo destaza dos animales a la semana y vende verduras. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir una galera para destazar los animales ya que se acerca el invierno y para comprar verduras. Así, no presentara inconvenientes cuando este lloviendo y tenga que destazar, por que no se mojara y dispondrá de verduras para vender aun más. Lo que pretende es ampliar su negocio para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 57 years of age. She is married and has four children. For the past 20 years she has worked slaughtering pigs and cattle. She learned this business from her parents. She used to have a store in her house, but now she sells vegetables and only slaughters two animals a week. 

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to build a slaughterhouse to prepare for the winter and to buy vegetables. This way, it won't be a problem when she has to slaughter while it is raining because she won't get soaked. She will also have fresh vegetables to sell even more. 

What she intends to do is expand her business so she can make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to construct a slaughterhouse in preparation for the winter and to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tailoring materials, including buttons, threads, needles and fabrics.

loans.name: Nduga

texts.en: Nduga has operated a food stall for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to buy maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents, and rice. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents and rice for her food stall.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is 25 years old. He lives in a small village in Zestaponi District with his wife and two infant children. Eldar requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. They sell cheese at local markets. Besides that, they have a one-hectare plot of land where maize is grown. It barely provides enough food for the family. According to Credo’s evaluation, the family belongs to the “subsistence poor” category. Eldar applied for a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Eldar will buy a minibus. After buying the minibus, he will begin trading in calves. He will buy calves at a good price and then transport them to resell at higher prices in different villages. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a minibus and start trading in calves.

loans.name: Kaari

texts.en: Kaari is a single mother of three children, who are all adults. She resides in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She has been a farmer for ten years, growing potatoes and bananas and selling them in the local market. She wants to venture into poultry farming, and that's why she has approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy poultry. This loan will help her to improve her living standards. The major challenges that she faces are of pests and diseases. She is satisfied with the services offered at Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to buy poultry to raise.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: For years, Zawadi has operated a coconut-selling business, selling from home to her clients and neighbours. She dreams of buying land and expanding her farming in the future. With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to buy more sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is married and has four children, who are now adults. She has practiced mixed farming for 30 years. She produces milk, bananas, maize and beans and sells them in the local market. She has requested a loan of KES 65,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy irrigation equipment. This will enable her to water her crops with ease. The major challenges she faces are drought, pests and diseases. In five years’ time, she plans to shift her farming and start specializing in dairy farming. Joyce says that Juhudi Kilimo is the best for her.

loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment for her farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph operates a green grocery business selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He is requesting a loan from Yehu, which he joined to access loans to boost his business, for 50,000 KES, which he will use to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, mangoes and cabbages.

Joseph faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions, mangoes, and cabbages

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Benkadi   est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leurs capacités financières afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de fruits et légumes à l’image de Saran. 
Saran, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, fait l’achat vente de fruits et légumes.  
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  3 chargements de charrettes en bananes, et 10 paniers de pomme de terre, choux aubergines et avocat auprès des grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et parfois à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group is made up of four women who are all married. They average 40 years of age and four children. Most of them live in traditional families in Torakabougou, a neighborhood in Bougouni.

They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood, friendship, and business. To strengthen their financial capacities and their businesses, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third loan.

The women in this group sell fruits and vegetables. Saran is the woman with papers in her hand in the photograph. She buys and sells fruits and vegetables.

She intends to user her part of the loan to buy three cartloads of bananas and ten baskets of potatoes, cabbages, eggplants and avocados, from local wholesalers.

She sells for cash and sometimes on credit, at the market and at her home, to a clientele comprising both men and women. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used to invest in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, cabbages, eggplants and avocados

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna sells women’s clothes. She is an energetic and communicative person. Anna hopes that her business will grow and help support her family even better. 

Anna is asking for a loan of 5,000 UAH (Ukrainian hryvnia). She wants to buy new clothes for the spring season, including blouses and shirts.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for the spring season, including blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita lives in the village of Yenokavan, in the region of Tavush. She is a widow and lives with her daughter, who is unemployed. For many years, she has worked at her village farm and, after several years, she has come to own her small farm, where she has three cows and ten chickens. At the same time, she works at a tour agency as a cleaner and dishwasher. The small salary that she has from her work barely allows her to cover the needs of her family and her farm. This is the first time that she is seeking to deal with Kiva lenders, and she has applied for a loan of 400,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to buy two calves and enlarge her farm. She thinks that the loan from Kiva field partner Nor Horizon will contribute to her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy two calves for her small farm.

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is 68 years old and widowed. He sells chicken in Kangemi, which he has been doing for nine years. He earns a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

Herman is requesting his fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to increase his stock of chickens to sell. In the future, he wants to open more shops.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is very hardworking, and she strives hard to meet the needs of her family. Here she comes again for another loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber and more palms trees for the renovation of her palm-wine business premises. She appreciates for the support given.

loans.use: to buy timber and more palms trees for the renovation of her palm-wine business premises.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 46 years old, married and the father of seven children. For the last 11 years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.

He learned about KADET LTD through posters. This will be his fifth loan. He plans to buy farm inputs such as manure and fertilizer.  

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of potatoes. His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more potatoes for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Fredis Noe

texts.es:
Fredís, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, asimismo hortalizas. El tiene 23 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, su hija y sus suegros; el oficio lo aprendió con sus padres  desde que tenía 13 años de edad, actualmente siembra media manzana de maíz y dos tareas de frijol, lo cual lo vende a Alba-Alimento debido a que es miembro de una cooperativa.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas, entre ellos: abono, pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas; este le ayudara a adquirir todo lo necesario para la siembra en este tiempo que están más bajos los precios de los materiales agrícolas  y lograra ahorrar.
Su sueño es seguir cultivando, también comprar algunas vacas para la crianza y así poco a poco ir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en: Fredís grows basic grains such as corn, beans, as well as vegetables.  He is 23, lives with his partner, his daughter and his parents-in-law.  He learned his trade from his parents from the age of 13 and now tends 3/4 acre of corn and 2 plots of beans which he sells to Alba-Alimento, as he is a member of the cooperative.  The loan he is seeking will enable him to buy agricultural supplies (manure, pesticide, insecticide, plaguicide and herbicide, among other things) and will help him to obtain everything he needs for sowing.  At the moment, agricultural materials are cheaper and he will, therefore, be able to make savings.  His ambition is to continue farming, to buy some cows for breeding and, as a result, see his business continue to grow steadily.

loans.use: to buy manure, pesticide, insecticide, plaguicide and weed killer.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married mother of one child. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food-stall business; her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations of products in the market.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 67 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial. Está casada y vive junto a su esposo en su casa propia .Rosa se dedica a la venta de dulces caseros como rosquitas, panes, suspiros limeños , entre otros. Diariamente acondiciona su puesto de venta en el frontis de un hospital de la ciudad. Prepara todos sus productos en su casa ya que ahí tiene un horno artesanal.En ocasiones sus ventas son muy buenas ya que logra vender todo lo que ofrece durante el día.Inició esta labor hace 20 años y gracias a ello a podido brindarles a sus hijos mayores una buena educación.Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias económicas que percibe constantemente. Por otro lado comenta que decidió iniciar esta labor pensando en el bienestar de su familia y para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ahora espera obtener un puesto de ventas más amplio en donde ofrezca una mayor cantidad de sus exquisitos productos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes.Con el monto solicitado comprará los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus dulces como harinas, azúcar, levadura, leche, huevos y aceite.
texts.en:
Rosa is 67 years old and is very hardworking, kind and friendly. She is married and lives with her husband in their own house. Rosa works selling homemade pastries and desserts such as rosquitas (a Peruvian pastry with anise and sesame), different kinds of bread, and suspiro limeño (a Peruvian pastry made from dulce de leche and meringue), among others. Each day she sets up her stall in front of a hospital in her city. She makes all of her products in her home, where she has an artisanal oven. Sometimes her sales are very good and she sells all that she has to offer that day. She started this business 20 years ago, and thanks to it she has been able to provide her children with a good education. She says her business is quite profitable and provides her with a steady flow of income. She also says she decided to start her business thinking of the welfare of her family and to help her husband with household expenses.

Now Rosa would like a larger stall from which she could offer a larger quantity of her delicious products. She is requesting 2000 PEN to buy ingredients she needs to make her pastries such as flour, sugar, yeast, milk, eggs and oil. She says she is very happy to know that she has financial support to continue with her business plan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, milk, eggs and oil.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 46-year-old mother from Migori county. She is married and blessed with three children who are 18, 15 and 12 years old, respectively.

She sells grocery items within the local market, a business she has been doing for the last 14 years, and makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. She has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more maize, beans and millet for her stock. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to stabilize the business and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase maize, beans and millet.

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
La cliente Maria, vive en Guayaquil. Ella comenzó su tienda hace unos 8 años atrás, para así tener mas ingresos. Poco a poco fue surtiendo su tienda hasta ahora que trabaja desde las 05:00am hasta las 21:00pm. 

Cada dia ella espera seguir superando con junto a su esposo(esta en la foto) para poder así darle lo mejor a sus 4 hijos que tienen 14,11,6 y 3 años de edad y están estudiando. En su tienda de víveres vende aceites, arroz, bebidas, granos, carnes, pollos, verduras etc. 

Debido a los ingresos de su tienda lo invierte en la misma ahora necesita un préstamo para poder comprar los útiles escolares de sus hijos, y papelería cuando este en clases, ya que ella quiere lo mejor para ellos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y poder agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Guayaquil.  She started her store eight years ago in order to get more income.  She was stocking her store little by little until she now works from 5:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.

Each day she hopes to continue improving together with her husband (he is in the photo).  She hopes to do this in order to be able to give a better life to her four children, ages 14, 11, 6, and 3.  The children go to school.  

In her store she sells provisions like cooking oil, rice, drinks, grains, meat, chicken, and vegetables, etc.  She uses her income to invest in the store.

She now needs a loan to buy school supplies for her children and paper supplies for when they are in school.  She wants the best for them.

In the future she wants to finish building her house and to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and paper.

loans.name: Jose Cecilio

texts.es: Don jose de 49 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol. Don jose desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: 49-year-old Jose lives with his wife and 3 children.  He is very responsible as far as his family obligations are concerned, having always demonstrated his desire to do his best for his children.   He has always gone about his farming work with tremendous commitment, good cheer and enthusiasm, and sows basic grains such as corn and beans every year.  Jose would like to boost his sales, and so is applying for a loan to buy manure, fertiliser and pesticide, among other things.  He hopes to receive the help he has requested since he has no other source of income and it will enable him to continue to provide for his family without any restrictions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertiliser and pesticide, among other things.

loans.name: Gloria Yessenia

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijas. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde los 14 años de edad; su padre fue quien le enseño. Hoy en día trabaja junto con su esposo en esa actividad. Además, posee una granja de pollos. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. a preparar el desayuno para sus hijas, luego las lleva a la escuela. Posteriormente, alimenta a sus pollos para luego retirarse con su esposo al campo a trabajar; finalmente en el medio día se regresa a la casa a preparar el almuerzo para sus hijas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 15 sacos de fertilizantes, tres galones de herbicidas, tres litros de pesticidas y dos bolsas de semilla.
