Mily requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of banana to sell.

Mily has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Mily would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of banana to sell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 47 years old and married with seven children, three of whom in school, Riza works very hard to provide for them.

Riza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, egg, spices, sardines, etc..

Riza has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future Riza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, soap, egg, spices, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Rafaela works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ginger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal. Rafaela is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell for her buy and sell ginger business.

Rafaela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of ginger to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 51 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by having a hog raising business in the Philippines. Carmelita is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmelita has been in this business for 26 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Angielyn

texts.en:
Angielyn is 38 years old, married and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Angielyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Angielyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, can goods, sugar, milk, etc..

Angielyn has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Angielyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, can goods, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 33 years old, married and has two children who are in school. 

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business farming vegetable in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jocelyn has been farming vegetable for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de  la cual tiene cuatro hijos, él es una persona trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, maíz, habas y cebada. También, él se dedica a la venta de oro. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Miraflores” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar oro.
  
Marcelino nació en la comunidad de Callacancha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació. (La comunidad de Callacancha está ubicada en el distrito del Paucartambo en la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Marcelino’s 34-year-old and is in a common law relationship; he has four children.  He’s a hardworking person who supports his family.  His main economic activity is agriculture.  He has several parcels of land where he grows potatoes, corn, lima beans and barley.  He also works selling gold.  He’s been a member of the “Miraflores” communal bank for several years and on this occasion he needs the loan to buy gold.

Marcelino was born in the community of Callacancha and still lives in the same community where he was born.  (The community of Callacancha is located in Paucartambo District in Paucartambo Province within Cusco Department, Perú.)

loans.use: to buy gold.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy everyday consumer products that she can sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 39 years old and married with ten children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items like can goods, chips, soft drinks, egg, etc to sell.

Myrna has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from retail of gasoline.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like can goods, chips, soft drinks, egg, etc to sell

loans.name: Ledemor

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ledemor works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Ledemor is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ledemor has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: ernesto habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y su hijo. Él se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol cuando su cosecha esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Es un hombre luchador. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia ya que para él es su principal fuente de inspiración y desea poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas (abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc.) que es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Ernesto lives with his wife and son in a house he owns.  He works growing corn and beans and when the harvest is in he stores it in the silos shown in the photograph.  This is how he earns his living and is able to provide daily bread for his home.  

He grows crops year to year and it’s the only way he knows to earn a living.  He’s a very hardworking, honest, responsible man.  Despite the conditions in which he lives which are very humble he does not tire of working and of giving his family the best.  He’s a fighter.  He’s always caring for his family because it is his main source of inspiration and he wants to be able to improve their living conditions.

He’s decided to request a loan to buy the main farm supplies (manure, poisons for infestations, seeds, etc.); this is the reason behind this loan request.  He hopes to have favorable results because he has no other source of income.  He trusts in God that he’ll obtain an abundant crop yield that will make it possible for him to continue providing his home’s daily bread.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Rene  Antonio

texts.es: don rene vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, fríjol desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia, para luego comercializarla en los mercados de granos basicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. don rene solicita un credito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
René lives with his life companion and their three children in a house he owns.  He’s worked growing corn and beans for several years and this has given him the necessary experience to properly care for his crops.  When the harvest is in he stores it in the silos shown in the photograph to then sell it in the local basic grain markets.  With profits earned he’s able to cover his household expenses.

René is requesting a loan to be able to buy the necessary supplies like fertilizer, herbicide and manure, among other things to get a good crop yield in order to earn higher profits to give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine began her career in the insurance industry as a representative of Blue Cross and Blue Shield, and after five years, she opened her independent life insurance agency as a Securus America provider. 

Katherine prides herself in pairing her clients with the appropriate insurance protections, spending countless hours to ensure her products meet their needs.  

Within nine months of operation, Katherine soon realized that customer service wasn’t all she needed to keep her business afloat. She quickly realized the importance of lead lists and the impact they could have in driving her business to find additional clientele.

With previous management experience as a health and wellness manager, Katherine was the ideal candidate for an Accion Texas Inc. loan.  With $5,450, she was able to purchase branded material and lead lists for direct mail campaigns.  Without her loan, Katherine would not have been able to generate the income needed for her life insurance business. She hopes to hire five new team members in the coming year who will help process the influx of interest in her services.

loans.use: to purchase branded material and lead lists for direct mail campaigns.

loans.name: Moises Alonso

texts.es:
Moisés, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol.  El está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad y no tiene familiares en el extranjero; la actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años y lo lleva a cabo todos los días de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm, hasta el momento no presenta ningún problema.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, entre otros; este le ayudara a adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios  y así con las  utilidades aportarle a su familia.
Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su hijo hasta verlo crecer.
texts.en:
Moisés grows corn and beans. He is in a relationship and has a one-year-old child. Moisés has no relatives who are living abroad. He has been in this trade for 10 years and carries out his work every day from 6:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. Up to this moment, he has not experienced any problems.

Moisés is requesting a loan so that he can buy compost, herbicides, fungicides, insecticides, pesticides, and other items. This loan will help him acquire the necessary farming supplies so that he can earn a profit to support his family. His dream is to improve his home and to support his son as he watches him grow.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, fungicides, insecticides, pesticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 59 years old and widowed.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like biscuits, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. to sell in her general store.

Leonora has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an additional income from raising livestock.

Leonora aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like biscuits, snack foods, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lilia is 56 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lilia has a general store business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like candies, snack foods, eggs, noodles and other groceries in her general store.

Lilia has been in this business for 4 years. Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like candies, snack foods, eggs, noodles and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family. Lilian is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lilian requested a PHP 15000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional box of fish to sell.

Lilian has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Lilian  would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Maria  Elena

texts.es: doña maria vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa de su propiedad y desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maiz y frijol cundo su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarla con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Ella quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and four children in a house that’s her property.  She’s been working in agriculture for many years and it’s her main source of income.  She grows corn and beans and when the harvest is ready she stores it in the silos shown in the photo to subsequently sell it.  She uses profits from the crop sales to cover some of her household expenses.

She wants to buy necessary supplies for her crops like manure, fertilizer and seeds but because she lacks the economic resources to make said investment she’s decided to request a loan since this is the only way she can continue with her planting process.  Like all farmers, she will put her trust in agriculture because she has no other source of income and she wants to get ahead doing the best she can with her crops.  She hopes to obtain an abundant crop yield that will make it possible for her to continue providing daily bread for her home and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a single mother of six, Nora developed her own business to earn a living and care for her family.

Nora’s business, April’s Cleaning Service, works to clean and disinfect newly-constructed and renovated offices so that they are ready to show to potential buyers.

To run her business, Nora applies hard work, dedication, and persistence. Even when speaking with Accion Texas Inc. on the phone as she obtained loan information, her voice echoed off the empty walls of a construction project she was cleaning up.

Nora used her Accion loan to purchase a van and to purchase cleaning supplies, such as soaps, rags, sponges, disinfectant sprays, and other concentrated cleaners. The loan also helped her buy fuel for the van so she can transport her services throughout the Brownsville, Texas area.

She will use the van to take on larger jobs in cities surrounding Brownsville. Nora works alone, but plans to hire an employee and to return to Accion for additional support as her business grows.

Nora was referred to Accion Texas by Chase Bank. After Nora applied and was approved for a loan, she became an advocate for Accion. She says because of Accion, her business runs smoother: “The growth is limitless with Accion by my side.”

loans.use: to buy a van to carry tools and cleaning supplies; to purchase soaps, rags, sponges, disinfectant sprays, and other concentrated cleaners; also, fuel to drive and market in the Brownsville area.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Oratorio Group

texts.en:
Last year in a rural area outside Totonicapan, Guatemala, a new Trust Bank, “Mujeres del Oratorio” was formed. The group consists of 13 women who have an average age of 29 years. Their average level of education is five years. The women are engaged in different businesses such as the sale of fruits, vegetables and water. One of the members owns her own bakery and sells bread daily. 

Brenda is a 20-year-old member of the Trust Bank. She works with her mother selling tortillas, fruit and water. They have a small storefront in a busy part of town. This works to their advantage, as many in the heavily traveled area patronize their small storefront.

Brenda is an ambitious young woman with a great desire to excel. She multi-tasks each day, getting up early to attend to her business. In the afternoon, she attends the local high school where she is a senior. Brenda looks forward to graduation later this year.

Brenda is currently requesting a loan with Friendship Bridge, which she will use to purchase more products that she can sell in her business. Her earnings will help Brenda meet her own educational needs as well as those of her three siblings! She will work diligently in her business because she realizes how valuable a loan is and how difficult it is to get credit anywhere else. Brenda tells us how fortunate she feels to have this working capital to invest in her business. Her great dream is to finish high school and then go to college. She is well aware of how important an education is and how her future depends on it.

Both Brenda and the other 12 women in the group are very excited to get these loans from Kiva investors and Friendship Bridge for their businesses. They expressed their gratitude to all in every area of the world who are providing this opportunity for them. They look forward to a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of tortillas, fruit and water.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 62 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lorna has a machine shop business in the Philippines. Lorna requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and supplies for her machine shop.

Lorna has been in this business for 15 years. Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies for her machine shop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP  through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, noodles, egg, spices, etc for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 7 years. Jocelyn earns more income from farming sugarcane and bakery.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, noodles, egg, spices, etc

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 33 years old and married with two children.

Marife works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store.

Marife has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns additional income from hog raising.

Marife aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, snack foods, noodles, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 52 years old and married with five children, one of whom in school, Juliet works very hard to provide for them.

Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soft drinks, soap, shampoo, milk, chips, etc..

Juliet has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Juliet would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soft drinks, soap, shampoo, milk, chips, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old and has four children. Marilyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business hog raising in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 13 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 12 years. Mary Grace earns more income from farming seaweeds.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lyndel

texts.en:
Lyndel is 27 years old and married with one child. Lyndel works very hard to provide for them.

Lyndel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, can goods, egg, noodles, etc..

Lyndel has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Lyndel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, can goods, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Mercy has been farming sugarcane for 7 years and also earns additional income from raising pig for nine years.

She is successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her farming sugarcane and raising pig businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 53 years old and married with two children. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like snack foods, sugar, noodles, coffee, cream and other groceries in her general store.

Milagros has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, sugar, noodles, coffee, cream and other groceries. 

Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like snack foods, sugar, noodles, coffee, cream and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Riza is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Riza has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks like spices, canned goods, noodles, milk, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Riza has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like spices, canned goods, noodles, milk, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia works hard to support her family. Olivia is married and has a buying and selling rice grains business in the Philippines.

Olivia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sack of rice grains to sell.

Olivia has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Olivia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sack of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Josie is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy food and household goods like can goods, toothpaste, soap, milk, egg, spices, etc to sell for her general store business.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy food and household goods like can goods, toothpaste, soap, milk, egg, spices, etc to sell

loans.name: Dania

texts.es: La señora Dania, una joven madre de familia ahora es soltera, tiene un hijo  a su cargo, tenía un pequeño negocio de venta de comida pero no le fue bien, por lo que decidió incursionar en la venta de ropa, cosméticos con lo que desea salir adelante para darle los estudios a su hijo menor y poder ir mejorando las condiciones de vida. Con este crédito que solicita desea invertir en variedad de ropa y cosméticos que le permita vender un poco más.
texts.en:
Dania, a youthful mother, is single now and has one child in her care.

She had a small business selling food that didn't go well for her, so she decided to get into selling clothing and cosmetics.  She wants to get ahead to give her young child an education and keep on improving her living conditions.

With this loan she's requesting she wants to invest in a variety of clothing and cosmetics so she can sell a little more.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Banco Mujer Kaneblapa Group

texts.es: Doña Marla sigue siendo la presidenta del grupo, su trabajo como líder del Banco Mujer ha sido muy bueno, y tanto ella como las demás socias del grupo han sido muy responsable y puntuales Este es el segundo crédito que solicitan. La actividad de Doña Marla sigue siendo la porcicultura y actualmente ella ha aumentado su producción, generando más ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su familia y el estudio de sus hijos, ya que es una madre soltera. La ayuda del financiamiento ha sido mucha, beneficiando las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia. La inversión será de cerdos, alimentos y concentrados, al igual que el préstamo anterior solo que en mayor cantidad para atender la demanda de pedidos que va en aumento. Continúan con Doña Marla las 6 socias que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Marla continues as group president. Her work as leader of the “Banco Mujer” group has been very good and both she and the other members of the group have been very responsible and punctual.  This is the second loan they’ve requested.

Marla’s work continues to be raising pigs and she’s increased production at present generating more income to cover family expenses and her children’s schooling costs since she’s a single mother.

The investment will be in pigs, feed and concentrate like in the last loan except that it will be larger to meet demand that’s been increasing.  

The six other members will continue like Marla investing in animal husbandry activities.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, animal feed and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large volume of provisions.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 47 years old and lives in Catagan, Tangub City. She is married with three children.
 
Remedios has a used clothing business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay the hospital bill for the operation of her husband. 

Remedios has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her life through the help of Paglaum.

loans.use: to pay the hospital bill for the operation of her husband.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 46 years old and has three children. Roger is married and has one child who is in school.

Roger is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. He requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vaccines for her pigs.

Roger has been in pig fattening for 7 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Roger would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Rubielyn

texts.en:
Rubielyn is 40 years old and married with five children, three of whom in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rubielyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Rubielyn has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Marlyn

Marlyn has been in this business for four years.

In the future Marlyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to re-stock her store with food and household goods like coffee, milk, sugar, cream, can goods, egg, etc to sell

Renalyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Renalyn has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Renalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a PHP 15000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Glorygen

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Glorygen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal.  Glorygen is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, wood, paints etc. for her fishing business.

Glorygen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishing net, wood, paints etc for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 55 years old, amrried and has ten children, two of whom in school.  

Gloria is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additionsal  feeds for her pig.

Gloria has been pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additionsal  feeds for her pig

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like nails, wood, paints, etc for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 8 years. Rosalina earns more income from general store.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nails, wood, paints, etc for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Santos Cayetano

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y a la ganadería. El vive con su esposa, sus dos hijos de 17 y 21 años de edad, ambos dependen económicamente de él; la actividad la heredo de sus padres, después le enseño a sus hijos, los cuales le ayudan a trabajar, lo realiza desde hace 40 años de 6:00 am a 6:00pm. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, abono; este le ayudara a obtener una buena cosecha, ya que utilizara buenos fertilizantes para el cultivo, el riesgo seria la escases de lluvia.
Su sueño es crecer en el negocio y seguir trabajando para obtener ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos makes a living growing basic grains as well as in livestock.  He lives with his wife and his two children, ages 17 and 21, both of whom are financially dependent on him.  He inherited his job from his parents, then taught it to his children, who help him work.  He has done this job from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. for 40 years.

The loan he needs will allow him to buy agricultural inputs such as herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and soil amendments.  This will help him get a good harvest because he'll use good fertilizer for the crop.  The risk would be a lack of rain.

His dream is to grow in his business and to continue working to earn an income.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, insecticide, pesticide, and soil amendments

loans.name: Rosa Ermelinda

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula, junto a tres de sus hijos. Hace dos años que ella estableció su propio negocio de venta de frutas como mangos, melones, sandia, papayas etc. y golosinas como churros, dulces, galletas y otros. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquiladora y al quedar sin empleo inicio el negocio para sostener a su familia. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar frutas de temporada y golosinas como churros y otros. Su plan es que el negocio se mantenga para lograr que sus hijos terminen los estudios.
texts.en:
Rosa, 40, is a single mother; she has four children and lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with three of her children.  Two years ago she opened her own business selling fruit like mangos, melons, watermelons, papayas, etc. and snacks like packaged snacks, candy, cookies and others.  The business is located at home.  She used to work in an assembly plant but when she lost her job she started the business to support her family.

She’s asking for a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy seasonal fruit and snacks like packaged snacks and others.  Her plan is that the business stays in operation so that her children can complete their schooling.

loans.use: to buy fruit, snacks and others to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 50 years old, married and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marina has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Carell

texts.en:
Carell is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carell is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Carell has a general store business in the Philippines. Carell requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, bread and other groceries in her general store.

Carell has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Carell would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, sugar, shampoo, bread and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Susan has been farming sugarcane for 6 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 31 years old and married with 2 children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Jessica has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Jessica aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers for her sugarcane.

Teresita has been farming sugarcane for 11 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her farming sugarcane and buy and sell livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her sugarcane

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 32 years old and married with 4 children, three of whom are in school. Roda works very hard to provide for them.

Roda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Roda has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, shampoo, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Roda would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old, married and has seven children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Gina has a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and other equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

Gina has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and other equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 54 years old, married and has 5 children, one of whom is in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Helen has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tequita

texts.en:
Tequita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell for her  business.

Tequita has been in this business for two years. Tequita earns more income from selling frozen foods.

Tequita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 55 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ninfa is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ninfa has been farming sugarcane for four years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Leonida works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Leonida is borrowing PHP 60000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Leonida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 44 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Daisy is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Daisy has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Diosa is 47 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Diosa has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Diosa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig fattening business.

Diosa has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Diosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes tiene 25años,  se dedica  a la pesca y venta de pescado su esposo es pescador y ella comercializa el pescado que su esposo pesca en el lago Titicaca,  ellos viven en una isla Del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo,   este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Lourdes va a usar este préstamo para la compra de un bote pesquero de mayor capacidad y redes, su producto de su pesca lo venden en la ciudad de La Paz y con este nuevo bote  quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, La Sra. Lourdes es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tienen para mantenerse.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 25, works fishing and selling fish; her husband’s a fisherman and she sells the fish her husband fishes in Lake Titicaca.  They live on an island in Lake Titicaca, a tourist destination in La Paz Department where wool and reed crafts are offered to the public.  Most of the island’s inhabitants work in fishing and in tourism.

This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Lourdes will use it to buy a bigger fishing boat and nets.  They sell their catches in the city of La Paz and she wants to use the new boat to increase production to meet customer demand.

Lourdes is a woman who very much wants to improve and she feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided since this is the only source of income they have to support themselves.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Shary

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Шари. Ей 52 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет  2 детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 26  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Она так хорошо ухаживает за своим скотом, словно знает и понимает язык своего скота. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки откорма для скота. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A kind person who always tries to improve her living conditions and hopes for a bright future needs support.  Her name is Shary.  She is 52 years old, married and has two children.  Because she lives in a rural area, she has a good opportunity to develop her business breeding cattle.  For more than 26 years, this has been her profession.  She has much experience in this arena.  She takes such good care of her cattle that she almost speaks their language.  Thanks to the good state of her animals, Shary has loyal clients.  She wants to grow her business and her income.  She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy feed for her cattle.  With the received in come, she plans to improve her living conditions.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy feed for cattle

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо 39-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее есть сын и дочь. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках в загранице. Мехринисо трудится и обеспечивает семью наравне мужа. Она занимается земледелием. Сейчас хотела бы начать новую деятельность. Мехринисо намерена заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Она планирует каждый месяц закупать, откармливать и перепродавать по 4-х голов скота. У нее имеется место для разведения скота. Чтобы начать деятельность Мехринисо обратилась за кредитом для закупа 4-х голов бычков и их корма.
texts.en: Mehriniso is 39 years old, married and has a son and daughter.  Her husband at the moment is a migrant worker in another country.  Mehriniso works and provides for her family as much as her husband, working in agriculture.  Now, she wants to start a new business buying and selling cows.  Each month, she plans to buy, fatten and resell four head of cattle.  She already has the land to do this on.  In order to start this business, she is requesting a loan with which she will buy her first animals and their feed.

loans.use: to buy four bulls and feed

loans.name: Chuipachaj Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank Chuipachaj (meaning “by the trees” in the Kiche Mayan language) is starting its sixth loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. This group is located in rural Totonicapan, Guatemala. The vast majority of the ten members are weavers. Their average age is 35 years.

The Trust Bank is led by a Board of Directors who have elected Margarita as their President. She tells us that she has been associated with Friendship Bridge for the past four years. 

Margarita is 38 years old and married. She is quite proud that her previous loans have enabled her to earn enough to support her entire family. She is especially pleased that her children are able to attend school. Her oldest daughter graduated from high school two years ago where she studied medicine. As she has not been able to secure a job in the medical field, she has been helping Margarita with her textile business. Margarita dreams of sending her daughter to college in the coming year.

Margarita is requesting a new loan to buy supplies, including thread, for her weaving business. She will work with her daughter to meet the demands of her customers and perhaps expand the business. There is enough money to pay for the household expenses. Both mother and daughter want to save some funds and open a pharmacy in her home or nearby.

Margarita and her fellow Trust Bank members enjoy the informative and useful training programs given by Friendship Bridge each month. They learn about timely and useful topics that help them in their daily lives, including effective business practices, health and family issues and self-esteem. The women cherish their time together, hearing of the progress that each is making in her life. They are happy and thankful to receive a loan and express their gratitude to Kiva investors and Friendship Bridge.

loans.use: to buy supplies, including thread, for her weaving business.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Nora operates a general store and sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month. 

Nora is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap. Nora has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, toothpaste, and soap

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda, 48 años de edad, habitante de la comarca el Potrillo, en las afueras de Boaco, de oficio agricultora, madre de 4 hijos , desde hace 8 años se dedica a esta actividad , ella solo finalizo la primaria, de sus 4 hijos solo una hija tiene a cargo de 17 años de edad que está estudiando la secundaria.
Doña Gumercinda se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol también tiene sus vaquitas y sus tierras donde trabaja  las heredo de su papa que murió. Además ella da a clases de preescolar a los niños de la comunidad en donde vive.
Ella requiere el crédito para comprar alambre y reparar las cercas del potrero.  Necesita tener sus potreros y huerta en buenas condiciones antes que comience  el invierno , ya que próximamente realizara sus siembras de maíz y frijol.
texts.en:
Gumercinda, 48, lives in Potrillo district outside of Boaco. She’s a farmer by occupation and the mother of four children.  She’s been in this line of work for 8 years.  She only completed elementary school.  Of her four children only a 17-year-old daughter who is attending secondary school is still in her care.

Gumercinda works growing corn and beans and also has cows.  The land she works was inherited from her father who died.  She also teaches pre-school classes to children in the community where she lives.

She needs the loan to buy wire to repair the corral fences.  She needs to have her corrals and farm in good condition before winter starts because she will soon start her corn and bean planting.

loans.use: to buy wire to repair the corrals.

loans.name: Cresencio De Jesus

texts.es:
Cresencio, es un humilde y trabajador campesino de 38 años de edad, habitante de una pequeña comunidad rural llamada Cusirisne , él se dedica a las siembras de granos básicos desde muy pequeño ya que es una actividad que aprendió por tradición desde sus padres tiene más de 20 años como agricultor . Parte de las vacas que tiene las ha ido comprando poco a poco con dinero de las siembras y de sus trabajos en Costa Rica cortando  melón y sandia. 
Hoy solicita su crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra para sembrar granos básicos. Además que tiene como proyecto ir mejorando la producción de leche por eso una de sus metas es comprar 2 terneras más para aumentar el ganado. Actividad que desea desarrollar y obtener otros ingresos.
texts.en:
Cresencio’s a humble, hardworking, 38-year-old farmer living in a small rural community called Cusirisne.  He has worked growing basic grains since he was very little since it’s an activity he learned by tradition since his parents have worked in agriculture for more than 20 years.  Some of the cows he has he’s purchased gradually with money earned from his crops and from his work in Costa Rica picking watermelons and melons.

Today he’s requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizer and to pay labor costs to plant basic grains.  He also has as a project to improve milk production so one of his goals is to buy two calves to increase his herd size.  This is an activity he wants to develop to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Loncia

She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Loncia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more banana to sell to her customers.

Loncia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more banana to sell to her customers.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies.

Helen has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Helen aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.ru:
Анатолий женат. У него двое взрослых детей. Анатолий ведет свой бизнес.

Анатолий занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке более 35 лет. Вместе с женой живет в своем доме, рядом находится дом и участок сына. Дочь заканчивает духовную семинарию и выходит замуж. Анатолий трудолюбивый и заботливый. На следующий год планирует ставить еще одну большую теплицу, потом нужно будет сделать отопление.

Анатолий просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 14000 гривен на покупку двух прицепов (11 тыс. гривен)- для себя и для сына, а также закупку удобрений(3 тыс. гривен)
texts.en: Anatoliy is married and has two grown children.  He runs his own business growing vegetables on his own land and has done so for more than 35 years.  He lives with his wife in their own home.  His son's home and land is located nearby.  Anatoliy's daughter is finishing seminary and is to be married.  Anatoliy is hardworking and caring.  Next year, he plans on building a large, additional greenhouse and he will then need to install heat.  He is asking for a loan of 14,000 hryvnia to buy two trailers (11,000 hryvnia) for himself and his son, and also to buy fertilizer (3,000 hryvnia).

loans.use: to purchase two trailers to transports vegetables and to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en:
Hussam is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past three years, Hussam has been operating an entertainment store containing video and computer games. 

Hussam has a good project located in a good movement area, where he has many loyal clients and has a good reputation among them. His project is a profitable one and the only source of income to him, but he needs more support to cover some necessary costs.

Hussam wants to improve his project, so he is requesting a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing PlayStation games (video games). This will allow Hussam to expand the scope of his work, improve his business, and increase his income.

Hussam is photographed in his entertainment store.

loans.use: to purchase new PlayStation games.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Alfonso habita en la comunidad Las Cañitas, casado, tiene 12 hijos los cuales  9 están casados y ya tienen su propio negocio don  solo tiene dos hijas a cargo de 18 y 22 años la cual una está estudiando en la universidad.  Alfonso se dedica a cultivar maíz  y frijol desde que tenía 15 años en tierras de su  padre. Hoy don Alfonso tiene sus propias tierras y su ganado también ha comprado un molino para moler maíz para tortilla. Sus actividades agrícolas   lo hacen con la ayuda de mozos y también dice que una vez que saca la cosecha la lleva a vender al mercado de Managua  ya que alla le pagan mejor el grano.  
 Don Alfonso está solicitando este crédito para comprar los insumos  tales como abono, fertilizantes, pago de mano de obra agrícola para la siembra del frijol. Pues necesita preparar los terrenos antes que inicie el invierno y como proyecto preparar sus tierras para el pasto de su ganado. Seguir luchando para pagar los estudios de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Alfonso lives in the community of Las Cañitas.  He has 12 children nine of which are married and have their own businesses.  Alfonso only has two daughters who are 18 and 22 years old in his care; one of them is attending university.

Alfonso has worked growing corn and beans since the age of 15 on his parents’ land.  Today, Alfonso has his own land and cattle; he’s also purchased a mill to grind corn for tortillas.  He does the agricultural work with the help of laborers and he says that once the harvest is in he takes it to be sold in the market in Managua since he’s paid better for the grain there.

Alfonso is asking for this loan to buy supplies like manure and fertilizer and to pay labor costs for bean planting because he needs to prepare the soil before winter starts and also has the project of preparing the land to graze his cattle and continue striving to pay for his daughters’ education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La Sra. Reina  sigue con la actividad de la venta de frutas, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de de frutas , creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de frutas según la temporada, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Reina continues selling fruit for a living.  She says that her previous loan went well as she used it to buy fruit.  She managed to grow her business, increase her number of customers and improve her income. 

On this occasion, Reina is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruit.  She feels happy and grateful for this new opportunity as this is the only business she has with which to support herself.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and has seven children. Josephine is married and has three children who are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business hog raising in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs.

Josephine has been in hog raising for 7 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and married.  

Rosario is in the agricultural business, hog raising in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Rosario has been in hog raising for 6 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosario would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Khurram

texts.ru: Хуррам житель города Истаравшан, северной части страны. Ему 23 года. Он женатый молодой человек. Хуррам с женой живет у своих родителей. Его отец уехал на заработки в заграницу, мать домохозяйка, а жена работает швеей. У Хуррам среднее образование. Он занимается животноводством уже 3 года. Хуррам покупает, откармливает и перепродает крупнорогатый скот. Одновременно он занимается земледелием. Хуррам запрашивает кредит для своей животноводческой деятельности. Он просит кредит для приобретения грузового автомобиля марки Газель для перевозики скота на рынок.
texts.en: Khurram is a resident of the city of Istaravshan in the north part of the country.  He is 23 years old.  He is a married young man.  Khurram and his wife live with their parents.  His father is abroad earning money, his mother is a homemaker and his wife works as a seamstress.  Khurram has a high school education.  He has been raising livestock for 3 year now.  Khurram buys, fattens and resells cattle.  Simultaneously he farms.  Khurram is asking for a loan for his livestock business.  He is asking for a loan for the purchase of a truck "Gazel" to transport livestock to the market.

loans.use: to buy a truck to transport livestock to market

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Чурабеку 35 лет. У него жена, сын и дочь. Он со своей семьей проживает в городе Истаравшан. У Чурабека среднее образование. Вот уже 7 лет как он занимается животноводческой деятельностью. Он покупает, откармливает и перепродает крупнорогатый скот. Ему помогает жена. Сейчас Чурабек обратился за кредитом для приобретения грузового автомобиля марки Газель. Он хочет использовать его для своей животноводческой деятельсноти для перевозки скота.
texts.en: Jurabek is 35 years old.  He has a wife, a son and a daughter.  He lives with his family in the city of Istaravshan.  Jurabek has a high school education.  He has been raising livestock for 7 years now.  He buys, fattens and resells cattle.  His wife helps him.  Right now Jurabek applied for a loan to purchase a truck, "Gazel."  He would like to use in his livestock business to transport animals.

loans.use: to buy a truck, "Gazel," to transport livestock

loans.name: Wanjala

texts.en:
Wanjala is married and has children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.
She has operated a fish selling business at the market, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors’. She faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing fish especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 
She is requesting for a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking  oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking  oil and firewood.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is  married has and children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a  charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal  for resale.

loans.name: Jose Heriberto

texts.es:
El cliente Jose vive en Guayaquil, el comenzó sus servicios de albañil desde pequeño para poder generar ingresos a su familia, poco a poco siguió en trabajando hasta ganar la experiencia suficiente y tener sus clientela fija. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 17:00pm para llevar alimento a su hogar ya que quiere seguir superándose. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en conseguir su negocio por eso quiere el prestamo para poder comprar cemento, bloques y herramientas para prestar sus servicios a otras personas ya que la actividad de albañil es de construcción de casas.
texts.en:
Jose lives in Guayaquil. He started offering his services as a bricklayer at a very young age so that he could generate income for his family. Over time he continued to work until he gained sufficient experience. Now he has an established clientele.

Jose currently works from 6:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. so that he can feed his household and continue to move forward. He has many aspirations of continuing his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to buy cement, blocks, and tools so that he can provide his services as a bricklayer to other people by building their houses.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, and tools.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo es transportista del servicio público, y vive con su esposa en casa alquilada en un acabado de fino  y piso de machimbre, en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento de su familia.
Justo  requiere el crédito para  el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (su mini bus) y así mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Justo es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Justo provides public transportation services.  He lives with his wife in a rented house that has fine finishing and wood floors in the city of La Paz’s Alto San Pedro zone.  He works more than 8 hours daily since this is his only source of family support.

Justo needs the loan to service his work tool (a minibus) to improve his income.  Justo’s dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to service his minibus.

loans.name: Favian

texts.es:
Favián  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche del Departamento de La Paz.  El vive con su esposa y sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de  COTA COTA, de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz; cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Favian es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Favián works raising dairy cattle to produce milk that he sells to an industrial milk processing plan in La Paz Department.  He lives with his wife and children in his own house located in the community of Cota Cota in Los Andes Province, La Paz Department three hours away from the city of La Paz.  He owns a few heads of cattle of an improved breed that require more care because of the weather conditions in the sector.

He needs the loan to buy building supplies like cement, bricks, etc. to repair the stable for the cattle in order to improve production keeping the cows in good health.

Favián’s dream is to increase his herd size and keeping them healthy.  This is his second loan request from Impro and from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to repair the stables.

loans.name: Yugas

texts.ru:
Югас – из Берегово. Он работает охранником в супермаркете. Югас с семьей и 3 детьми живет в собственном 3-комнатном доме. 
Югас обратился за суммой в размере 9 000 гривен для того, чтобы улучшить свои жилищные условия. Он хочет покрыть дом теплоизоляцией, чтобы сэкономить деньги во время отопительного сезона. На данный момент штукатурка внешней стены до сих пор не окончена и нужно обложить ее изоляцией, чтобы создать для семьи нормальные условия проживания, что особенно актуально, когда в доме 3 маленьких детей.
texts.en: Yugas is from Beregovo.  He works as a security guard at a supermarket.  He has three children and lives with his family in a three-room house.  Yugas is asking for a loan of 9,000 hryvnia to improve the condition of his home.  He wants to insulate in order to save money during the cold season.  Currently, the stucco finish on the outer walls has still not been completed and it needs to be finished for the family to have normal living conditions.  This is particularly important considering there are three small children in the home.

loans.use: to insulate his house

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна уже несколько раз пользовалась финансовой помощью КИВА. Вырученная после реализации последней партии товара прибыль, помогла семье Татьяны приобрести микроавтобус поновее, что существенно посодействует ее мужу в его бизнесе, связанном с грузовыми перевозками. 
В этот раз Татьяна обратилась за суммой в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить женскую одежду и трикотаж, тем самым пополнив рынок сезонными товарами. Татьяна сможет предложить своим клиентам новое поступление сезонного товара, таким образом увеличив свой доход.
texts.en: Tatyana has already used Kiva's financial support a few times.  The proceeds from the last batch of inventory she purchased and sold helped Tatyana's family buy a newer vehicle which helps her husband in his business hauling and delivering.  This time, Tatyana is requesting a sum of 5,000 hryvnia to buy seasonal women's clothing and knitwear to sell at  market.  Tatyana will be able to offer her clients new goods which will increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal women's clothing

loans.name: Mize

texts.en: Mize is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.Currently she wants to start a nursery school at her village and that is the reason as to why she is asking for a loan  of Kshs 40,000 to buy desks and textbooks for the young children that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: . to buy desks and textbooks for the young children

loans.name: Kingi

texts.en:
Kingi is a married mother who lives in Likoni.She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.Currently she is running an open air food making business to earn a living and support her family.

She always struggles to improve her food vending business, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment.She is requesting for a loan to buy beans, sugar, vegetable oil, vegetables, beef, chicken and food packaging for the facilitation of her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, vegetable oil, vegetables, beef, chicken and food packaging.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a divorced woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school.She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. She is grateful and thankful for the opportunity give.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman and staying together with her husband and four children. She rents a house that  has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food,rent and school fees. 

For the past one year, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has operated a food stall business for the past six years,in addition she cooks chapati (flat bread) rice and beans and sells them to her customers who are her fellow villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of Kes 12,745, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food vending business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a divorced woman with four school going children . She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling clothes for both men and women. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

She is requesting for Kshs 50,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future and she appreciates much for the support given to her by Yehu and Kiva at large. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema always struggles to improve her green grocery, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment.She is requesting for a loan to buy sacks of vegetables,fruits,tomatoes and onions for resale to her clients to increase her monthly income and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sacks of vegetables,fruits,tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Time

texts.en:
Time is a single businesswoman,she lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. 

She has operated a cloth and curtains selling business. she cites seasonality and stiff competition from other operators to be her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to buy bales of clothes and curtains for resale to earn profit and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes and curtains for resale

loans.name: Okemer

texts.en:
Okemer is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as cereals,beans,maize flour,wheat flour and soft drinks for her store that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as cereals,beans,maize flour,wheat flour and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married mother of two children, who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes and shoes selling business and her clients are ladies,she sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 100,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Nyiro

texts.en:
Nyiro operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors.She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale vegetable shop business in the near future.She is asking for a loan of kes 30,000 to 
buy tomatoes, onions, carrots and vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to  buy tomatoes, onions, carrots and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a food vending business for the past twelve years, cooking chapati (flat bread),dumplings, rice and beans. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan of Kes 40,000, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for her food business.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

She has operated a boutique business, operating at the market whereby passersby and friends are her potential customers. She faces a stiff competition from other boutique operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her boutique shop.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her boutique shop.

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is a single woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.
