She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.en:
Wilfrida has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale . She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future she appreciates for the help and opportunity given.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale .

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 50,000 to expand on her exiting business. With the loan, she wants to purchase consumables of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice to prepare food for the cafe. She is grateful for Kiva lenders and Yehu microfinance for the opportunity.

loans.use: .to purchase consumables of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice to prepare food for the cafe.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is married and blessed with two children all of whom attend school. They live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids. 

She has operated a khanga (women raping cloth) selling business. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other operators to be her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more khanga for resale to gain more profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more khanga for resale to gain more profit.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a divorced woman with two children, all of whom attend from school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past six years, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers are her clients. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to add stock into her beauty salon like hair braids,shampoo and hair lotions business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to add stock into her beauty salon like hair braids,shampoo and hair lotions business.

loans.name: Daina

texts.en:
Daina is a married woman with one child whom attends school and is under her care. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For over one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door and from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, that she is requesting she wants to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of kids wear clothes for resale

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married , staying together with her husband. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past one year, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the village. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Leonel Mauricio

texts.es:
Leonel tiene 22 años de edad, esta soltero, vive junto a sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace dos años; empezó ayudándole a un tío en este negocio, luego su tío se fue y él quedo sin trabajo, por lo que pensó en instalar su propia venta de ropa; pero como no tenia suficiente dinero compraba por medias docenas de camisas y hasta que las vendía compraba más. Después solicito un préstamo a Fundación Campo para instalar el bazar. Hoy en día solicita otro para tener variedad de mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes. Se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para marcharse a su bazar.  La mercadería la compra en la capital del país, para abordar el autobús camina a pie 18 minutos y el autobús tarda dos horas en llegar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 docenas de pantalones para hombre, 2 docenas de pantalones para mujer, 2 docenas de camisetas y 2 docenas de blusas, una docena de zapatos, una docena canchos, ropa interior para hombre, 3 docenas de calcetines, una docenas de punteras, una docena de pañuelos y una docena de pañueletas.  Con el préstamo comprar por mayor para viajar una vez al mes y disponer de suficiente mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, aumentando la posibilidad de mejorar sus ingresos, para ahorrar y pagar el préstamo y ampliar su bazar, casarse y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Leonel, 22, is single and lives with his parents.

He has made a living selling clothing for two years.  He began helping an uncle in this business.  Then his uncle left and he was out of a job, so he planned to set up his own business selling clothing.  He didn't have enough money, though, so he bought shirts by the half-dozen and when they were sold bought more.

Then he requested a loan from Fundación Campo to set up in the market.  Currently he's requesting another loan to have a variety of merchandise to sell to his customers.

He gets up at 5:30 a.m. to go to his store.  He buys his merchandise in the capital.  He walks 18 minutes to get the bus, which takes two hours to get there.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 3 dozen pairs of men's pants, 2 dozen pairs of women's pants, 2 dozen t-shirts and 2 dozen blouses, a dozen pairs of shoes, men's underwear, 3 dozen pairs of socks, a dozen shawls and a dozen scarves, and other items.

With the loan he'll buy wholesale to travel once a month and have enough merchandise to sell to his customers.  This increases his possibilities for earning income, for saving and paying back the loan, for expanding his store, and for getting married and having his own family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis es soltero y  no tiene dos hijos, viven en casa en anticretico, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Ciudad Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto.
El  estudió hasta el nivel secundario, actualmente tiene una tienda  de barrio donde vende una gran variedad de productos como ser: leche, galletas, refrescos de distintas marcas y otros; además,  Jose Luis  es taxista y trabaja dos noches por semana  con la movilidad de su cuñado.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir helados y hambuguesas congeladas, ya que es lo que su clientela le exigen con mayor frecuencia. Adquiriendo estos productos su capital de trabajo aumentaria  y sus ingresos de igual manera.
El sueño de Jose  Luis es tener un almacen (es decir una tienda más grande con mayor variedad de productos).
Es la segunda  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
José Luis is single and has no children.  He lives in a house under the ‘anticrético’ modality [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] located in the city of El Alto’s Ciudad Satélite zone.

He completed secondary school and currently has a neighborhood store where he sells a wide variety of goods like milk, cookies, various brands of soft-drinks, and others.  In addition, José Luis is also a taxi driver and works two nights per week using his brother-in-law’s vehicle.

He needs the loan to buy ice-cream and frozen hamburgers which is what his customers request most often.  Acquiring these items will increase his working capital and his income will increase likewise.

José Luis’ dream is to own a store (that is, a larger store with a wider variety of products).  This is his second loan request to IMPRO and first to KIVA.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream and frozen hamburgers for his grocery store.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi aged 52 years, is a married woman with eight children. She owns a house that neither has electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a kiosk business, selling household consumables of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale shop business in the near future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has operated a fish selling business, selling fish to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality a to be her major challenge and also competition from other fish sellers. 

Here she comes to you again requesting for Kshs 50,000 to purchase more bundles of dry fish for sale.  She dreams of establishing a fish shop in the near future and be the main supplier of fish in their village.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Kuvuna

texts.en:
Kuvuna aged 41 years, is a married woman and lives with her husband  at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 
She has operated a firewood selling business for the past ten years. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned stiff competition to be her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase stock of firewood  for sale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood  for sale.

loans.name: Karege

texts.en:
Karege is a widowed woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a food stall selling business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, wheat flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Kholisamo

texts.ru: Холисамо жительница города Куляб, расположенный на юге страны. Ей 42 года. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. У нее две дочери и два сына. Муж Холисамо занимается купле-продажей овощей. Сама Холисамо работает швеей. Она вышивает женские национальные платья уже 10 лет и принимает заказы у себя на дому. Холисамо не только шьет платья, но и делает на них вышивку. Кредит берет для приобретения компьютерной швейной машинки и тканей для вышивания.
texts.en: Kholisamo is a resident of the city Kulob, located in the south of Tajikistan.  She is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She has two daughters and two sons.  Kholisamo's husband works buying and selling vegetables.  She herself works as a seamstress.  She embroiders the national women's dress and has done so for the ten years.  She works from her home.  Kholisamo not only sews the dresses, but does the embroidery.  The loan she is taking will allow her to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabric for her business.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine and fabrics for embroidery

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Ms Noreen is 25 year old lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past two years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to meet household expense. She is separated from her husband and working hard to lead a decent life instead of becoming a burden on her parents. By the time she has attained regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute in the family income. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Ms Rukhsana is 45 years old married woman and a mother of six.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for the past fifteen years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of Rs.35,000/- to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers and buttons in different colors to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en: Ms Hameedan is a 52 year old married woman; she has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gain 15 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of good from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Niwer

texts.en: Ms Niwer is a 20 year-old, single woman. She has been running a business of stitching clothes from the last 6 years. She is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Niwer was not earning her family was going through sever financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf. She requested for Rs 25, 000 and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors. She is n her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads in different colors.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Ms Mumtaz is a 32 year-old, married woman. She has been running a business of beauty parlor from last 5 years. Her husband is an employee but earn low income to deal with the expenses of the family members alone.  So she started business of beauty parlor to contribute in the family income and to provide quality education and other basic needs of life to her children. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy packs of cleansers, facial with hair rollers in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater more customers time after time. She expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy packs of cleansers, facial with hair rollers in large quantities.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Ms Hanifan is a 52 year-old woman and a mother of two. She is running a business of cloth trade in her community from the last 3 years. She purchases variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. Hanifan requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths of the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths of the summer season.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Ms Rehana is a 24-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been successfully running a business of cracker sales for many years. She deliciously makes them at home and then sells to the people of her community and makes enough through this business. Rehana has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase packs of oil, salt and flour to increase her sales. She hopes to have an increase in her net income and wants to spend part of it on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of oil, salt and flour to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mildred quien con su credikiva compro mercancía en general, ella está muy satisfecha porque pudo ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, porque con más inventarios pudo vender mas, generar utilidades con las que compró un televisor para sus hijos.  Por eso dice a los financiadoras de Kiva: “Gracias por ayudarme a tener mi propia actividad de negocio y obtener otros ingresos económicos. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará un carro de comidas rápidas, para aprovechar su experiencia pasada cuando practicaba ese mismo negocio y con ello generar otro ingreso adicional, con el que hará de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support Mildred received with her Kiva loan, she was able to buy general merchandise. She is very pleased because she was able to help her husband with the household expenses. Since she had more inventory, Mildred was able to sell more and use the profits to buy a television for her children. For this reason, she says to the Kiva lenders: “Thank you for helping me have my own business so that I can generate more income.”

Mildred is currently applying for another Kiva loan so that she can buy a fast food cart. She plans to take advantage of the experience she gained from her current business so that she can have an additional source of income. This result will make this Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a fast food cart.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres es casado, tiene dos hijos: uno de dos años y otro de  un mes de vida, viven en casa de la tía de su esposa, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona  Villa Mercedes de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundario, ahora trabaja en una empresa en la cual se dedica al fabricado de muebles. Su esposa arma una variedad de vestidos para bebe, esos ingresos cubren los gastos de la familia. 
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir material de construcción (arena, estuco, pinturas) así podrá refaccionar su vivienda que fue afectada por estas épocas de lluvia.
El sueño de Andres es tener una casa propia y ampliar el taller de costura para su esposa.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Andrés is married and has two children, a two-year-old and a one-month-old.  They live in his wife’s aunt’s house located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Mercedes zone.

He completed secondary school and is now employed by a furniture making firm.  His wife makes clothes for infants.  Their income covers family expenses.

He needs the loan to buy building supplies (sand, stucco, paint) to repair his house which has been damaged in the rainy season.

Andres’ dream is to own a house and to enlarge his wife’s sewing workshop.  This is his first loan request to Impro and to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es casada y tiene un hijo de 5 años que cursa el en kinder, viven en casa de los propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Ballivian  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudió hasta el nivel secundario, ella con la ayuda de su esposo trabajan en la elaboración de frazaditas para bebé, sus trabajos lo realizan en su mismo domicilio.
El crédito lo requiere para  adquirir materia prima que es la tela polar estampada ya que por estas fechas tiende a escasear, además adquirir otra máquina más, así podrá aumentar su producción.
El sueño de Dora  es tener un gran taller de costura y realizar una gran variedad de productos, así ella también generar nuevos empleos.
Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Dora’s married and has a five-year-old son attending Kindergarten.  They live in her own house located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Ballivian zone.

She completed secondary school and she helps out her husband making baby blankets; they work from home.

She needs the loan to buy raw material, printed thermal fabric, because it tends to become scarce these days.  She also wants to buy an additional sewing machine to increase production.

Dora’s dream is to have a large sewing workshop and to make a variety of products so she can generate employment.  This is her first loan request to Impro and to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy thermal fabric to make baby blankets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy insecticides, anti-plague chemicals, pesticides, herbicides, and fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a very hardworking woman who is doing her best to provide for her family.She again comes to Yehu and Kiva to request for another loan to boost her business, since she has successfully repaid her previous loans. 

With the loan, she will use to add more clothes,umbrellas and utensils for her  business to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to add more clothes,umbrellas and utensils for her  business to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a married man; he has thirteen children who attends school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He has operated a livestock selling  business where passersby and town dwellers are his potential customers. He has a challenge of seasonality especially during rainy season it becomes difficult to transport the livestock to his place of work. 

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno has operated a retail shop business for the past 8 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers staying for long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates for the opportunity from Kiva and Yehu at large.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Kahce

texts.en:
Kahce aged 50 years, is married and has nine kids. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 
 
She has operated a livestock selling business, selling to her neighbours and passersby as they are her customers. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi aged 40 years, is a married woman and lives with her husband Denis at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children. 

Mishi has operated a charcoal selling business for the past ten years. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned stiff competition and transportation to be her major challenge in the business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase 24 sacks of charcoal for sale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 24 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is taking out another Kiva loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more desks and renovate the classrooms to create conducive environment for the children. She is grateful for Kiva lenders and Yehu microfinance for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more desks and renovate the classrooms to create conducive environment for the children

loans.name: Nachiro

texts.en:
Nachiro is a married mother of six children all whom attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to her place of business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a large store of charcoal  in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 6 sacks of charcoal for resale and use the remaining cash to transport the charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Nahenza

texts.en:
Nahenza is married and has five children all of whom attend school. he owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past twenty years, he has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers are his customers.

With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat for sale.He dreams of expanding to a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat for sale.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 42 years of age, married and with four kids who attend school which is the reason of his hard work.  he owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

He has operated a restaurant  business  for the past 13 years, selling to passersby and neighbours,he cited seasonality and theft as his challenges in the business. 

With the Kshs 80,000 he wants to purchase stock of goods, wheat flour, rice and  soft drinks for his restaurant. His dream is to see his children get better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods, wheat flour, rice and  soft drinks for his restaurant

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with 1 child. Helen is 49 years old and lives in Tipan, Sinacaban.

Helen sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. Each month she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 30,000 to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Helen hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is married with 12 children. Dioscora is 59 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Dioscora operates her sari-sari (convenience) store to earn a living and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo and toothpaste.

Dioscora has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Dioscora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo and toothpaste.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Ms Nusrat had a difficult time after her husband’s death.  Being a single parent of her child she decided to work to support her family for a better future. Three years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 20,000. It would help her to purchase more spools of threads with the packs of buttons, laces and zippers in different colors. Nusrat wants to expand her business to be able to stand on her own.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with the packs of buttons, laces and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Ms Safia is 31 years old married woman; she is providing services of parlor for many years to the people of her community. She very well knows the art of makeup and hair styling. Through her best providing services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for her parlor.  But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 20,000. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is hopeful to cater more customers time after time. She wishes to spend the part of revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Ms Robina has expertise in embroidery and is using her skill to provide her family for over four years now. Over the time, she has become famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. She makes enough to meet the expenses of her four children and has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000. This loan amount will be used to purchase more spools of threads with the packs of glittering material, sequins and pearls in different colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Robina has taken up

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with the packs of glittering material, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Ms Azra is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. For about four years she is been in work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors with the packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more customers consistently.  She is in her 8th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. Azra dreams for her children's bright future and desires to provide them quality education. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors with the packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment.

loans.name: Kathrain

texts.en: Ms Kathrain is 45 years old, a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family alone. Kathrain’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household.  She is a mother of three children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 35000, to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She is hopeful to get increase in her net income and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Ms Safia is 42 years old married woman and running a business of milk selling with her husband sine 5 years. She has three buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. She makes enough to contribute in the family income. She is a mother of three and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000/- to buy one more buffalo to carter more customers. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to get increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Maraj

texts.en: Ms Maraj is a 57-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. She has gain three years of experience in this field and now she has three buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Ms Aliya is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. One year ago she began stitching clothes in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle and has borrowed Rs. 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads in different colors with the packs of laces and zippers to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads in different colors with the packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Sahrish

texts.en: Ms Sahrish has been running a business of hand-embroidery for the last 5 years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. She has become famous for providing unique and beautiful embroidery and makes enough to lead a decent life. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs 20000, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Ms Shazia is 41 years old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the last one year. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is doing government job in Pakistan railway, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Shazia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of two children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000/- to buy raw materials such as spools of thread with the packs of sequins and pearls in different colors. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her area. She would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread with the packs of sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms Razia is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is doing a business of tailoring since 16 years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested for a loan of Rs. 35000/- to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to complete the orders of her customers on time; her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Razia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving good standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Ms Sajida is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is doing a business of manufacturing ‘waan’ which is a thread like material used in making of bedstead of wooden frame on four legs. She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors, and has become famous for providing good quality material in her community. Sajida operates the machine at home and is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. She is trying hard to fulfill the needs of her family members. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied from the support of it. Currently she has applied a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy another good machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy another good machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms. Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a business of carpet manufacturing and has attained regular list of customers. Previously she took a loan to purchase raw material and it helped her to earn enough amount of income to meet the family expenses.  Currently she applied her fourth loan of Rs. 15,000 to purchase good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. Naseem expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of profits on providing good quality food, health and education to her children. She is thankful to Kashf and Kiva for its support.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Schools are the most important institutes for bringing change in underprivileged community. Here is a story of a man by name Tahir who was deprived basic necessary in his childhood. He studied in a public school and faced many problems throughout his life. He found many problems in his study and found non-conducive environment.  Tahir wants to serve his community through quality education.  He explained his dream of community oriented school for the deprived children. He said I feel pain for the children who are not going school because of financial barriers. He also shared that he has been punished in his school due to late fee submission and it marked on his heart. He was neglected student and often asked for room cleanliness. At that moment, he decided to open a school for deprived children. He opened his school by the name of “Reliance Grammar Public School” in October 2011. At that time 35 students were enrolled and 3 teachers were hired. Tahir shared that he has no enough income and facilities to run this school within limited resources. Tahir heard about Kashf Foundation Micro finance program and met Kashf staff for school loan purpose. Kashf team briefed him about Kashf School Sarmaya and its procedures. Tahir shared about his mission and vision to the Kashf team members. And discussed if he will get the loan, he can provide many other good opportunities to his learners.  He got loan Rs. 100,000/- for computer lab and swings for his school. He said through this loan his school environment will be child friendly and computer skills give them good opportunity. He said, children from low income background will get quality education and become responsible citizen.

loans.use: For computer lab and swings for his school

loans.name: Sababoumandogo  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SABABOUMANDOGO III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants  et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelle à  M’PEDOUGOU, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : pois sucré  avec  KADIA SERIBA  1ere  à gauche de la photo position assise.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, et les frais de labours  pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sababoumandogo III Group are married women with an average age of 40 years, and an average of four children. They live in traditional families in M'Pedougou, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan cycle for rural agriculture, and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Kadia Sériba (shown in the photo seated on the far left), grows crops of sweet peas. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

Kadia Sériba expects to earn an average monthly income of 110,000 FCFA per farming cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en: Ms Riaz is 58 year old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and needles to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 1st loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and needles.

loans.name: Hajira

texts.en: Ms Hajira is 48 years old and the mother of four children. For the past 20 years, Hajira has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 30000 to purchase another buffalo. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Roqia

texts.en: Ms Roqia is 47 years old married woman; she is doing a business of shoe making from the past six years. During a year of her business she has low capital because of many problems in receiving payments on time and was unable to expand her business activities. At that point in time, she was afraid of taking informal loan from relatives so then she contacted Kashf foundation upon the suggestion of her neighbor.  She is an energetic person and eager to support her family by improving their standard of living. Her son also helps her in doing this business of shoe making. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation. By the support of Kashf Foundation she is fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her household expenses. Now, she requested a loan of Rs. 35000 to buy additional material of shoes including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand of her shoes in the market which ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy additional material of shoes including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles etc.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Ms Salma is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been successfully running a business of flower making for many years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies in the local market.  She has good communication skills and has a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family and wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy raw material such as fabric of various types and glace papers with the packs of paints in various colors. In this way she would be able to meet with the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric of various types and glace papers with the packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Ms Sobia is 28 years old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been running a business of animals’ sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up then and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough to contribute in the family income. Currently she requested a loan of Rs.25, 000 to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and wishes to provide better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Ms Zainab, age 26, deals in a business of cloth trade. She buys a variety of ladies’ cloths from the main city market and sells them to the people of her local community. She started her business because it was very difficult for her to meet her household needs with only the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute in the family income. She has been in association with Kashf for the past two years. At present, she is requesting a loan of Rs. 35,000, which will allow her to purchase a greater selection of summer season cloths in different colors by taking in account the taste and choice of her customers. Zainab expects a boost in her net income through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of summer season cloths in different colors by taking in account the taste and choice of her customers.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Don Marcelino es casado y tiene dos hijos un varón y una mujer que están en etapa escolar, vive en la casa propia donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Bajo Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja de chófer con movilidad propia como trufi; el recorrido y ruta es desde la zona Achachicala, siendo su parada en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz  y la esposa también ayuda en el trabajo y al cuidado de los hijos,  ambos  colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta, y educación de sus hijos.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar el mantenimiento de su movilidad, ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.
El sueño de Marcelino es poder contar con dos movilidades y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Marcelino’s married and has two children: a boy and a girl who are school age.  He lives in a house he owns that has a living room, bedroom kitchen and bathroom.  The house is adobe with cement floors and is located in the city of La Paz’s Bajo Tacagua zone.

He works as a cooperative taxi driver with his own vehicle.  His route is from Achachicala and his stop is in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  His wife helps him with his work and also caring for the children.  They both contribute to pay for utilities, food, clothing and their children’s education.

He needs the loan to pay to service his vehicle since it’s his only source of income.  Marcelino’s dream is to own two vehicles and to improve his quality of life.  This is his first loan request to Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Yesit

texts.es:
Yesit es soltero,tiene dos hijos; vive en la casa de sus padres donde cuenta con un ambiente y se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, baño, la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de cemento, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tarapaca de la Ciudad de el Alto.
Actualmente trabaja de chofer con movilidad propia como trufi, con  recorrido y ruta fijos,  desde la zona Alto Achachicala siendo su parada en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz; Yesit   colabora en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta, de sus papas.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento semestral de movilidad, ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.
El sueño de Yesit es poder contar con otra  movilidad propia, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y la segunda con KIVA.
texts.en:
Yesit is single and has two children.  He lives in his parents’ house where he has a living room, bedroom kitchen and bath.  The house is adobe with cement floors and is located in the city of El Alto’s Tarapaca zone.

He currently works driving his own car as a cooperative taxi with a fixed route itinerary from the Achachicala Alto zone with his stop being in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  Yesit contributes to his parents’ utility, food and clothing expenses.

He needs the loan to pay for his vehicle’s mid-year service since it’s his only source of income.  Yesit’s dream is to own a second vehicle to improve his quality of life.

This is his fifth loan request to Impro and second to Kiva.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Muso

texts.ru: Мусо 54 года. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Мусо со своей семьей проживает в районе Шахритус. У него среднее образование. Он занимается растениеводством. Мусо имеет земельный участок, на котором выращивает бахчевую культуру. Он занимается этой деятельностью уже 8 лет. Семья помогает ему в ведении сельского хозяйства. Сейчас Мусо хочет посеить арбуз, так как в жаркое лето будет сезон арбуза. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для закупа семян арбуза. В будущем Мусо планирует заняться еще и животноводством.
texts.en: Muso is 54 years old, married and has one child.  He and his family live in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan.  He has received a higher education.  He works in agriculture and has a plot of land on which he grows melons and gourds.  This has been his profession for eight years.  His family helps him runs his business.  Now, Muso wants to plant watermelons since the warm summer is the watermelon season.  With this goal, he is asking for a loan to buy th seeds.  In the future, Muso plans to begin also working with livestock.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seeds

loans.name: Sherlinita

texts.en:
Sherlinita is married with only 1 child. Sherlinita is 52 years old and lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Sherlinita sells peanuts to earn a living and has had this business for 23 years. Each month she earns PHP 3,000 from doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to purchase peanuts and other ingredients.

Sherlinita has been a member of PMPC for 9 years.  In the future, Sherlinita hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase peanuts and other ingredients

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with 3 children. Josephine is 41 years old and lives in Sebac, Tudela.

Josephine sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month she earns PHP 3,000 from doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, Josephine hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is 57 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Francia has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Delia has requested a loan to purchase more ingredients for her snacks and viand (meals) business.

Francia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Francia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her snacks and viand (meals) business.

loans.name: Sababoumandogo  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  SABABOUMANDOGO IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 3  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelle à  M’PEDOUGOU, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : pois sucré  avec  DJAMA  1ere à gauche de la photo position assise.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants,  pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sababoumandogo IV Group are married women with an average age of 37 years and an average of three children. They live in traditional families in M'Pedougou, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan cycle for rural agriculture, and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Djama (shown in the photo seated on the far left), grows crops of sweet peas. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy the agricultural inputs needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

Djama expects to earn an average income of 90,000 FCFA per farming cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural inputs needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland

loans.name: Sababoumandogo  V Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe SABABOUMANDOGO V sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans,  3 enfants  et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelle à  M’PEDOUGOU, un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (SIKASSO).
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : pois sucré  avec  NANZAN  au milieu de la photo position débout.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et payer les frais de labour,  pour entretenir : 1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200 000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi de réinvestir dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sababoumandogo V Group are married women with an average age of 37 years and an average of three children. They live in traditional families in M'Pedougou, one of the villages in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan cycle for rural agriculture, and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Nanzan (shown in the photo standing in the center of the back row), grows crops of sweet peas. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

Nanzan expects to earn an average income of 200,000 FCFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and pay for the labor cost of maintaining one hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Ms Shamim is 49 years old and a mother of six children. Eight years ago, she started her business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied a loan of Rs. 30000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Ms Mumtaz is a 53-year-old married woman. For the past 6 years, she has been successfully running a business of milk sales in her community. Over the time, Mumtaz has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Mumtaz is requesting a loan of Rs. 30,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to purchase another cow to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Shaheda

texts.en: Ms Shaheda is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She faced many financial problems in her early married life as it was very tough for Shaheda to manage her house needs with the small income of her husband. Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she started her business of clothes selling as she buys used clothes in different colors and designs and then after proper cleaning and ironing sells in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family. To inflate her sales she wants a loan of Rs. 15000/- to purchase stocks of summer clothes in different designs. It would increase her earnings and hence she can better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of summer clothes in different designs.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Ms Yasmeen is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two children.  She is trying hard to fulfill their demands including food, health, clothing, and education. She has been doing a business of making artificial flowers for many years. She offers various handmade artificial flowers in different colors which are used in making garlands and decorating homes and rooms. By the time she has become famous in providing good quality colorful flowers in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. For the improvement of her business applied a loan of Rs. 20000. This will help her to purchase raw material such as various types of fabrics including silk, tissue in different colors with the packs of glues and wires. In this way she would be able to get an increase in her earnings through her large sales.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as various types of fabrics including silk, tissue in different colors with the packs of glues and wires.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Ms Kalsoom is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Kalsoom’s husband. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over the time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their two children. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy stock of rice, grains and sugar to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, grains and sugar to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Ms Shabana is a 26-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching clothes. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community and makes enough to contribute in the family income. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Currently she requested a loan of PKR.20,000 to purchase more reels of threads with the packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Shabana hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing good standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with the packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Shahmeem

texts.en: Ms Shahmeem is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She is doing a business of animals’ sales and purchase for the past 12 years. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. It’s her 2nd year with Kashf Foundation; currently she applied a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase two more goats. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation and wants to grow her business to provide good quality food, heath and education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Ms Yasmeen is a 34-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past three years, has been running a business of cloths sales. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Yasmeen is requesting a loan of Rs. 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Yasmeen expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members. she is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Ms Parveen is a 41-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of cloth trading for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. Over the time, she has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. Parveen requested a loan of PKR 25000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Ms Sajida aged 32 enjoys her work of packing and selling tamarind for 6 years now. It is a popular street item in a country like Pakistan. Mostly females are fond of eating it as it has sour and sweet taste. Sajida is doing this business with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Sajida’s husband who assists her in purchasing a stock of tamarind from the market. After doing packing they sell it to the people of their vicinity and make enough to fulfill the needs of their two children.  Now Sajida requested a loan of Rs 25,000 PKR to buy good taste tamarind in bulk with the bundles of wrapping sheets which will help in increasing sales. She hopes to earn more profits and will use the part of profits on her children’s education, better health and food.

loans.use: to buy good taste tamarind in bulk with the bundles of wrapping sheets.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Ms Irshad is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is doing business of stitching since 5 years to support her husband. Income of her husband is low to bear the household expenses alone. That is why Irshad is working hard to continually provide for her family. She very well knows the techniques of stitching and earns enough to lead a decent life.. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of Rs.35000/- to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers and laces to meet up with the increasing demand. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors with the packs of zippers and laces to meet up with the increasing demand.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ms Ishrat is a married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making artificial jewelery for many years. She beautifully makes necklaces, earring and bracelets in many colors and designs. The business has great potential for growth and Ishrat is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. She has six children; two of them are going to school. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Ishrat requested for a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and hopes to get increase in their net income and intends to use part of it on providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Ms Iqbal is a married woman; she has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 5 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salts, oil, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She has been in association with Kashf Fondation since six years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Iqbal is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, oil, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Ms Shabana is 34 year old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She is a mother of six children and motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, health and education. By the time she attained regular list of customers but for now, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support. She wants good quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Ms Nabila is a 31-year-old married woman. She is doing business of tailoring for the past ten years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Nabila’s husband who is a tailor by profession. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for the family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested for a loan of Rs. 35,000/- to purchase more reels of threads with the packs of buttons and laces in various colors. In this way they will be able to complete the orders of their customers’ on time. Nabila wants to grow her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads with the packs of buttons and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en: Ms Sumaira is 26 years old married woman and a mother of three children; two sons and one daughter. She has been running a business of animals’ sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. In order to purchase one more cow she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of Rs. 15,000.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos, de 29 años de edad el se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan, y tambien como actividad secundaria se dedica a la crianza de animales, se a dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años y gracias a Dios le a ido bien en su negocio y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de arina y materiales para la ealboracion de pan, y tambien para la compra de animales para la crianza.
texts.en: Juan Carlos, 29, works making and selling bread and as a secondary activity raises animals.  He’s been in this activity for four years and thanks to God he’s done well in business.  He’s asking for this loan to buy flour and other bread baking supplies and also to buy animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy flour and other baking supplies and to buy animals to raise.
